Wipe the mushrooms with kitchen paper, remove the stalks and discard. Oil the caps of the mushrooms and place on a baking tray, gill side up. Season with crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Crumble the blue cheese into a small bowl and mix with the chopped cranberries, apricots and thyme and sprinkle over the mushrooms.
Unroll the pastry onto a lightly-floured surface. Lightly roll out the pastry to form a 30cm square. Cut the square into four squares, each measuring 15cm.
Brush the edges of the pastry squares with beaten egg and place one square of pastry, egg-side down, over each mushroom. Press the pastry around and under the mushroom caps to seal.

Score the top of the pastry in a criss-cross pattern. Brush with beaten egg and bake for 16‚Äì18 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown. Remove from the oven and leave to stand for 2 minutes before serving.
Crush 5 amaretti biscuits into the bottom of 4 glasses then pour over a tbsp of liquor or juice into each glass then leave to stand for 10 minutes.
Place a layer of cherries on top of the biscuits, followed by a layer of sliced bananas, then the jelly and custard. Lightly whisk the double cream, then sweeten with a little icing sugar.
Cover the tops of the trifle with the whipped cream and scatter over a few toasted almonds.
Leave in the fridge for 1 hour or overnight before serving.

ingredients.text: 1x 400 g tin reduced fat coconut milk
Small bunch fresh coriander, finely chopped

instructions.text: Very finely chop the ginger, chilli, shallots and garlic and fry off in a large pan along with the bruised lemongrass in around 5ml oil for 3-4 minutes.
Add the butternut squash and cook for a further 3-4 minutes then add the coconut milk and stock, and simmer for around 15 minutes or until the squash is tender.
Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Finish by adding finely chopped coriander, soy sauce, the juice of a lime and the sugar.
Serve with jasmine rice.

ingredients.text: good-quality dark chocolate, at least 70% cocoa solids

instructions.text: Grease a large baking tray with butter and preheat the oven to 180C/ gas mark 4.
In a large, spotlessly clean, dry bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff then gently fold in the ground almonds and sugar.
Wet your hands, take a tablespoon of the mixture and roll into a finger shape about 6cm long.
Place on the baking tray and repeat the process, spacing them well apart.
Bake in the middle of the oven for 15-20 minutes until beautifully golden. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, place the chocolate in a small glass bowl over a pan of simmering water and allow to melt (ensure the bowl does not touch the water. otherwise the chocolate will become bitter).
Dip the base of each finger biscuit in the chocolate and place on a baking sheet (chocolate side face up) until set.

Once set, turn the biscuits over and with the help of a fork, drizzle over more chocolate sauce, creating a zig-zag effect. Alternatively, you may prefer instead to just dip half of the biscuit on one side.
Serve once the chocolate has set, with a cup of coffee.

ingredients.text: 1x 566 g pack of chicken thighs and drumsticks (approx 5-6 pieces), on the bone

instructions.text: Flour the chicken and place in a large non-stick pan along with a little oil and brown on all sides. Add the pancetta and cook until golden.

Add the onion, garlic, mushrooms and thyme and cook for a few minutes to soften then pour the cider in and deglaze the bottom of the pan. Add the stock, cover with a lid and simmer for 1 and a half hours.
Just before serving, stir in a tablespoon of cr√®me fraiche.

To make the champ, boil the potatoes in salted water until softened and cooked through (this should take around 15 ‚Äì 20 minutes), drain then mash. Warm the milk gently in a pan then add to the potatoes along with a small knob of butter (if you want to be even healthier, leave out the butter altogether ‚Äì you could add a few drops of olive oil instead).
Combine and mash until smooth. Season then stir in the spring onions.
Serve with the cider braised chicken

recipes.title: Brussel sprouts with chesnuts roasted garlic and hazelnut

instructions.text: Cook the sprouts in large pan boiling water until slightly overcooked, then drain well.
Heat the butter and oil, then add the garlic and cook until lightly browned.
Tip in the nuts and stir well, then add the sage and cook for a couple of minutes
Add the sprouts back to the pan and coat well.
Season well with salt and pepper and serve.

recipes.title: Crispy roast potatoes with thyme and garlic

ingredients.text: 100 ml approx of sunflower oil, or dripping, goose or duck fat

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 220C (425F), Gas mark 7.

Place the potatoes in a pan of cold salted water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 8-10 minutes until the outsides have just softened. Drain and return to the pan for a minute or two to dry out.

Meanwhile, pre-heat a roasting tin with a 1cm (1/2in) depth of oil, dripping, duck or goose fat for a few minutes until just smoking. Roughly prod the outside of the potatoes with a fork and toss them with thyme and garlic. Carefully tip them into the hot oil, basting the tops. Roast for about 45 minutes to 1 hour, turning occasionally, until crisp and golden.

To serve, transfer the roast potatoes with a slotted spoon into a warmed serving bowl and season with the sea salt and place them directly on the table ‚Äì eat immediately ‚Äì they don‚Äôt hang around!

recipes.title: Baked carrot and parsnip batons in a bag with thyme

ingredients.text: Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C (350F) / Gas 4. Peel the carrots and parsnips and then cut into even-sized batons. Take a large piece of tin foil or a double sheet of parchment paper and pile the root vegetable batons in the middle.

Scatter the shallot, garlic and thyme over the root vegetables and dot with the butter, then drizzle over two tablespoons of water. Season to taste, then fold in the sides of the parcel to enclose the root vegetables. Do this by bringing up the sides, then folding over and twisting the edges.

Place the foil bag on a baking sheet and roast for one hour until the carrots are meltingly tender and slightly caramelised. To serve, either open the foil parcel at the table or carefully pour the carrots and parsnips and all of their juices into a nice big warmed dish.

recipes.title: Sauteed Brussel sprouts with lemon and garlic

ingredients.text: 900 g Brussels sprouts, outer leaves removed and trimmed
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Cook the Brussels sprouts in a pan of boiling salted water for about 6 minutes. Drain and refresh in cold water. Drain well, then chop into rough pieces.

Heat the butter in a large frying pan or wok until nut brown. Add the sprouts and saut√© until lightly brown. Season well and add enough garlic to taste with the lemon rind and parsley. Cook for another minute, tossing the pan occasionally and then tip into a warm serving dish and serve at once.
Take the peeled clementines and separate into segments. Arrange on a plate with the Serrano ham slices. Next, crumble over the pecorino cheese
To make the dressing, mix the honey with the vinegar and oil set aside
Remove any stalks off the watercress and toss together with the dressing
Lay on the plate and sprinkle with cracked hazelnuts, then drizzle any remaining dressing over the dish before serving

Melt the butter in a pan over a medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes to soften, add the port, sugar and rosemary, stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Increase the heat and boil rapidly for 1-2 minutes.
Add the cranberries, bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 8-10 minutes until the cranberries have softened. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve at room temperature.

recipes.title: Scallops with roast chorizo and balsamic glaze

ingredients.text: 25 scallops, off the shell, coral removed
crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
Large handful of rocket leaves, washed

instructions.text: Preheat the grill to high. Slice the chorizo into 25 slices, no more than 0.5cm thick, and grill for 3 minutes, turning once, until crisp. Remove from the heat, cover with foil and set aside.

Season the scallops with crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat the oil in a wide, heavy-based frying pan and fry the scallops over a high heat for 40 seconds. Turn and cook for a further 40 seconds.
Squeeze over some lemon juice, then add knob of butter. Drain onto a kitchen towel.

To serve, arrange the scallops and chorizo on 6 serving plates. Drizzle around the balsamic glaze and spoon any remaining chorizo oil from the grill pan. Sprinkle over the rocket leaves and garnish with dill.
Cut the figs into quarters and carefully pack lightly into a jar or container.
Place all the other ingredients into a stainless steel pan, bring to the boil and simmer for 2 minutes.
Pour the liquid over the fresh figs, and seal the container. Leave overnight or ideally a day or two.
Drain the liquid off the figs before serving.

ingredients.text: 1 small, red chilli, seeded and chopped
salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Mix together the mayonnaise, chilli, spring onion, and coriander.
Next add the tomato ketchup and a dash of Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco and brandy.
Add the slightly squeezed out prawns and mix together, then season with salt and pepper. If possible, leave to marinate in the fridge for 2-3 hours

Toast the bread under a preheated grill on both sides until golden brown. Cut off the crusts, then using a bread knife, cut horizontally through a slice of toast to give two thin pieces. Cool slightly then rub the uncooked sides of the toast together to remove any loose crumbs. Repeat for the other slices.
Cut each slice in half diagonally and reduce the heat of the grill then toast the uncooked sides of the bread until golden, crispy and crunchy.
To serve, slice the lettuce very finely and add to a tall glass or beaker. Spoon in the cocktail and top with a little smoked paprika and the melba toast.

ingredients.text: 400 g can of chopped tomatoes, drained reserving juice

instructions.text: Heat oven to 190C/gas Mark 5. Heat oil in a large frying pan or wok, add onion and pepper and cook for 5 mins, add spice mix, beans, turkey, tomato puree and tomato juice. Cook for a few minutes.
Season well, then spoon into wraps. Roll up wraps and lay them in a baking tray. Scatter over tomatoes and cheese adn bake for 15-20 mins until golden.
Sprinkle with coriander and serve with cream.
Bring a pan of water to the boil. Peel the potatoes, then cut in half or quarters. Place in the boiling water and cook for 8-10 minutes until the edges become soft.
Whilst the potatoes are cooking, place the goose fat into a large tray and heat in the oven preheated to 200C.

When the edges of the potatoes are soft, drain well. Give the potatoes a shake to fluff the edges, then place into the hot fat. Sprinkle with sea salt and spoon the fat over the potatoes before placing them back in to the oven to roast for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown.

ingredients.text: Couple of glugs of double cream
3 thick slices of stale white bread, cubed

instructions.text: Heat the oil in large saucepan, add the celery and onions and fry for 5 minutes. Add the parsnip, nutmeg, salt, pepper, wine, cream and stock. Bring to the boil and simmer for 15 minutes.
While the soup is simmering, toss the bread, herbs, oil and seasoning in a bowl. Scatter on a baking tray and bake in an oven for 5-10 minutes.
When the parsnips are soft, whizz the soup with a stick blender until smooth.
Serve and scatter with croutons.

ingredients.text: 100 g salted butter, plus extra for greasing
250 g good-quality dark chocolate (70% cocoa solids)

instructions.text: Grease a 23cm loose-based tin and preheat the oven to 180C/ gas mark 4.
Place the butter and chocolate in a large glass bowl over a pan of simmering and allow to melt. Ensure that the water in the pan doesn't touch the bowl, otherwise the chocolate will become bitter.
Whisk the egg yolks and icing sugar in a second large bowl until fluffy and pale in colour.
In a seperate large, spotlessly clean dry bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff.
Pour the melted chocolate into the bowl with the egg yolks and sugar and combine thoroughly. Mix in the ground almonds then immediately fold in the egg whites gently, using a metal spoon.
Pour the cake mixture into the tin and cook in the middle of the oven for 25-30 minutes.
Remove the Caprese from the oven and leave it to rest for 10 minutes before unmoulding.
Slice and serve at room temperature with a tablespoon of clotted cream and a little glass of amaretto liqueur.
Preheat the oven to 200C.

Roll the pastry out into a 25cm by 15cm rectangle. Spoon the mincemeat down the centre of the pastry. On both sides of the mincemeat use a knife to cut 11 tabs 1 cm from the mincemeat to the edge of the pastry.

Brush the whole surface with the beaten egg, then alternating the sides, bring the tabs of pastry to the centre of the mincemeat, crossing them over one another, creating a plate down the centre of the pastry.
Once you have used all the tabs, press the end down firmly to seal, then place on a baking tray and brush the whole thing with egg.
Place in the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown, then remove from the oven, dust with icing sugar and serve with double cream.

ingredients.text: Zest and juice of one orange

instructions.text: Top and tail the carrots (no need to peel). Cut the larger carrots in half, then place in saucepan.
Add the zest and juice of 1 orange to the pan, a knob of butter then add the water.
Bring to the boil and then cover and simmer for 5 minutes until tender.
After 5 minutes add the parsley and cook for a further 3-4 minutes before draining and serving.

ingredients.text: 4 slices good smoked bacon‚Ä®, cut into lardons
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C.

Season the pork fillet with salt and pepper then sprinkle over the sugar. Heat a frying pan over a high heat, add a dash of olive oil. Sear the meat until brown on all sides. Then transfer the pork to an oven tray, cover with foil then cook in the over for 15-20 minutes until cooked through.

Place the frying pan over the heat once again and deglazed with the white wine vinegar. Bring to the boil then stir in the tomatoes puree and chicken stock. Simmer for 5 minutes then season to taste with Worcestershire sauce and tabasco. Season with salt and pepper and finally stir in 25g butter.
Fry the leeks and bacon in a little olive oil until crispy. Stir through your mashed potatoes. Serve slices of the pork on top of your leek and bacon mash, with a drizzle of sauce and green beans.

ingredients.text: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a frying pan.
Add the onion and garlic and cook gently until softened.
Place the cream cheese into a bowl, then add the cooled onion mixture and season well, add the chives and honey and mix well.
Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4. Cut the bread on an angle into slices about 1.5cm thick and brush over the remaining olive oil.
Season bread well and cook, turning occasionally, for about 20 minutes, or until light golden and crisp. Allow bread to cool to room temperature.
Spoon the chilled cheese mixture onto the bread, then wrap half a pepper in the chorizo and sit on the cream cheese. Serve.

recipes.title: Mulled wine poached pear and almond tart

ingredients.text: 2 pears (Williams or Rocha), slightly under-ripe, peeled, halved and core removed with a melon baller
Your choice - Extra thick double cream, cr√®me fraiche, ice cream or clotted cream

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4.
To make the mulled wine, put the bottle of red wine in a large saucepan with the all other mulled wine ingredients. Heat gently until all the sugar has dissolved and warm until just before boiling.

Add the pears (already peeled, cored and halved) and simmer for approx. 20mins, until the pears are tender. The time can vary depending on the ripeness of the fruit, the pears need to be fairly soft so they are easily sliced.
Remove the pears from the pan and set aside to cool.
Strain the mulled wine. (This is now ready to serve, or can be kept in a pan and warmed later).
Line the pastry cases.

Mix together ground almonds, caster sugar and cream in the butter. Add the eggs one at a time, then stir in almond extract. Fill the pastry cases with the almond filling. (Do not fill quite to the top as the pears need to go in and the mixture will rise in the oven).
Slice the pear halves (to approx. 0.5 cm thickness) and arrange on top of filled pastry cases. Bake in the oven at 180C/Gas 4 for 20-25 minutes until the filling has risen and is golden brown.
Serve with a glass of warm mulled wine and ice cream or cream.

recipes.title: Artichoke, mint and smoked paprika dip

ingredients.text: 1 lemon, finely zested, plus half juiced

instructions.text: Heat the oil, then add the onions and garlic and cook for 10 minutes to soften and take a little colour.
Add the artichokes and oil and warm through, then add the paprika and really mix well.
Cool then place into a food processor and blitz until smooth.
Spoon into a bowl and add the mayonnaise, zest of the lemon, juice, mint and mix well, season well with salt and pepper.
Brush the pittas with a little oil, then bake until crispy. Remove from the oven and cut into long strips. Serve with the dip.

ingredients.text: 1 small onion, peeled and finely chopped
Salt and freshly milled black pepper

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the onions, allspice and garlic and cook for a few minutes until soft and translucent.
Add the sausage meat and stir well.
Just break down the sausage meat but do not actually cook it through.
Then cool slightly, add enough bread crumbs to stiffen up the mixture, but remember that they will continue to thicken as they reconstitute themselves, so take care not to add too many.
Stir in the whole egg and cranberries and beat the whole mixture well.
Finally add the Christmas pudding and some salt and pepper. Stuff the bird when required.

ingredients.text: 1 small onion, peeled and finely chopped
2 tbsp fresh thyme, roughly chopped or 1 tbsp dried thyme
175 g whole chestnuts, peeled (vacuum packed variety are very good)
1 satsuma, chopped finely, including half of the skin
Salt and freshly milled black pepper

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the onions and garlic and cook for a few minutes until soft and translucent.
Add the thyme and sausage meat and stir well. Just break down the sausage meat but do not actually cook it through.
Then cool slightly, add enough bread crumbs to stiffen up the mixture, but remember that they will continue to thicken as they reconstitute themselves, so take care not to add too many.
Stir in the whole egg, Satsuma pulp and beat the whole mixture well. Finally, add the chestnuts and some salt and pepper. Stuff the bird when required.

ingredients.text: 1 small onion, peeled and finely chopped
1 small bunch of coriander, roughly chopped
Salt and freshly milled black pepper

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the onions and garlic and cook for a few minutes until soft and translucent, add the sausage meat and stir well.
Just break down the sausage meat but do not actually cook it through.
Then cool slightly, add enough bread crumbs to stiffen up the mixture, but remember that they will continue to thicken as they reconstitute themselves so take care not too add to many.
Stir in the whole egg, coriander and apricots and beat the whole mixture well.
Finally add some salt and pepper and fill the cavity of the bird. Alternatively, you can place the stuffing in tin foil and roll up to bake separately from the turkey.

ingredients.text: 125 g butter, cubed and very well chilled

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 190C/Gas 5.
Place the cold butter and flour into a food processor and blitz.
Place into a bowl with the cheese, paprika, mustard, poppy seeds and season well with pepper.
Add the egg and mix to a soft dough, then chill well.
Roll out with plenty of flour and cut into small rounds, place on the baking tray.
Bake for 15 minutes, then cool before trying to remove from the tray.

recipes.title: Chocolate and hazelnut ice cream in a Marsala panettone shell

ingredients.text: 60 g icing sugar, plus more for decoration
130 g good quality chocolate (70% cocoa), roughly chopped

instructions.text: Pour the cream in a large bowl and add in the icing sugar. Whip until fluffy. Add in the chocolate, hazelnuts and 1 tablespoon of Marsala wine. Let it rest in the fridge for 15 minutes.
Pour the remaining Marsala wine in a bowl and pour over 100ml of cold water. Mix all together and set aside.
Line a 1.5 litre round bowl with a large sheet of cling film.
Cut the panettone into 1cm slices and use them to line the bowl. Brush the Marsala mixture over the sponge.
Pour the cream mixture into the centre of the bowl and gently knock the bowl on the counter top to make sure that there are no air bubbles.
Cover the cream mixture with a lid of panettone slices soaked in Marsala wine. Cover with cling film.
Freeze the Zuccotto for 4 hours.
Before serving, place the Zuccotto in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
Transfer onto a serving dish and dust with icing sugar all over.

recipes.title: Cranberry, white chocolate and clementine tin cakes

ingredients.text: 200 g white chocolate buttons, or chopped bars

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 170C/Gas 3. Wash and scrub 4 small empty baked bean tins so the wrapper comes off. Dry well and line with greaseproof paper.
Beat together the eggs, vanilla extract and milk.
In another bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and clementine zest. Cream with the butter and then pour in the egg mix and stir well. Fold in the chocolate and cranberries.
Divide the batter between the 4 lined tins and bake for 30 minutes or until springy to the touch.

To make the glaze, dissolve the sugar in clementine juice over a medium heat till it develops a syrupy consistency. Prick the cakes several times with a skewer and spoon over glaze so it soaks through the sponge.
Decorate the cooled tins with festive labels and pretty ribbon.
Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4.
Beat together the soft butter with the sugar until creamy. Stir in the baking powder, golden syrup and egg yolks.
Stir in the plain flour, ground cinnamon and ginger, mix well.
Place onto the work surface to bring together if needed, then place into the fridge to rest for 30 minutes.
Cut in half and roll out half at a time to approx 1cm thickness then cut out into whichever festive shape you wish.

Place onto a non stick baking tray covered with parchment paper and place into a preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, until golden brown. Remove, allow to chill and decorate with icing or sprinkles as you wish.

Note: If you want to hang these on the Christmas tree, then as soon as they come out of the oven and are still warm make a small hole in the top for the ribbon, and once cool, thread a clean piece of ribbon through and hang on the tree.

ingredients.text: 280 g green apple nectar (available in supermarkets, but choose one that is thick, not juice)
160 g fresh pineapple, cut into small cubes

instructions.text: For the Luciano, mix the apple nectar and sugar syrup together and divide between four tall narrow glasses. Top up with cold champagne and serve immediately.
For the Rocco, place all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Shake for about 30 seconds, and pour immediately in martini glasses.

ingredients.text: 300 g plain flour, plus extra for kneading

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 170C/Gas 3. Line a baking tray with parchment.
Tip the flour, sugar, baking powder, cardamom powder, blueberries, chocolate, pistachios, salt and orange zest into a bowl.

Mix well with a spoon and add the beaten eggs a little at a time bringing together the dough. It will seem dry to begin with but knead well until the dough comes together. It it's slightly sticky, add a touch more flour.
Turn the dough out onto a flat surface and divide into two equal portions. Roll each one out into a sausage shape, about 20cm long.
Place on a baking tray and bake for 30 minutes until it's risen slightly and feels firm on the surface.
Take the baking tray out of the oven and place the biscotti onto a wire rack to cool slightly. Turn the oven down to 140C/Gas 1.
Now slice them diagonally into 1cm thick pieces and lay flat on the baking tray and return to the oven for a further 30 minutes, turning over half way through.
Once done, cool on a wire rack and store in an airtight container or jar.

ingredients.text: 4 slices of bacon, cut into lardons

instructions.text: Marinate the boar in the wine, spices, vegetables and herbs for 12 hours, in the fridge.
Add the vinegar and marinate for a further 12 hours, in the fridge.
Drain the boar onto kitchen paper, pat dry. In a hot pan, brown the meat in olive oil until dark in colour.
Pop into a casserole dish with the vegetable and wine and cook at 150C/Gas 2 for 3-4 hours.
Pan fry the bacon lardons, shallot and mushrooms in the butter. Coat in flour and add to the wild boar stew.
Once the boar meat is tender and falling apart, the stew is ready. Serve with celeriac mash.
Preheat the oven to 200C/Gas 6.
Rub the flour and butter together. Stir in the sugar, zest and peel.
Add the eggs, bring together to a stiff dough.
Pile onto a greased baking sheet, quit roughly. Bake for 15-20 minutes. DO NOT OVERCOOK.
Remove from the oven and cool.

ingredients.text: 12 sticks of candied orange, chopped finely
100 ml course clementine or orange marmalade
2 tbsp icing sugar, plus extra for decoration

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200C/Gas 6.
For the sponge, beat the egg whites with an electric whisk until stiff, adding 50g of the sugar whilst you whisk.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks with the remaining 80g sugar. Stir in the melted butter, add the sifted flour and baking powder, then fold in the stiff egg whites.

Pour the mixture onto a baking tray with parchment paper. Spread evenly and cook in the oven for approximately 10 minutes, until the top is set and springy. Remove from the oven, place a damp tea towel over the top and allow to cool.
Now make the filling. Whip the cream to a ribbon stage, add the chopped candied orange and marmalade and continue whisking until stiff.
Soak the sponge with the orange liquor, then evenly spread the cream on top. Using the parchment paper, roll the sponge up keeping nice and tight.

Next make the glaze. Melt the chocolate in a bain marie with the butter then add the orange liqueur and sugar. Allow to cool then pour over the sponge. Leave to set for 2-3 hours covered at room temperature, or you could leave it overnight.
Decorate with clementines, chocolate shavings and icing sugar.

ingredients.text: 1 large red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped
4 tbsp flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a large pan, add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the sherry, chilli and parsley and season well.
Allow to bubble for 30 seconds, then add the mussels, cover with a lid and cook for 3-4 minutes until opened and cooked.
Serve hot on top of garlic bread or cold dressed with olive oil and finely chopped tomatoes.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil and fry the dried chillies and the mustard seeds until all the seeds have popped.
Now add the chopped onions and ginger and once they turn transparent, add the cranberries, tomatoes, sugar and salt to taste.
Simmer this until it becomes thick and syrupy. Add the garam masala during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Taste and if you want a bit more depth of spice, add more garam masala.

ingredients.text: 1 pineapple, cored and cut into chunks
½ tbsp coarsely ground black pepper

instructions.text: In a heavy based saucepan, heat the oil on a medium flame.
Add the cumin seeds and chopped garlic, saut√©ing for a couple of minutes.
Tip in the pineapple chunks and stir, cooking it for 7-10 minutes.
Now add the vinegar and sugar. Stir well to make sure the sugar dissolves. The brown sugar will give the chutney a lovely caramel colour.
Simmer on a medium heat and cook for a further 10 minutes.

At this stage add most of the black pepper, leaving a pinch aside for later. If you feel your chutney is drying out, you can add a bit of water to moisten it. Continue to simmer for 45 minutes until the chunks soften and most of the moisture has evaporated. You are looking for a syrupy consistency.
Now add the remaining crushed black pepper and stir through. Leave to cool and spoon into sterilised jars. Seal and leave unopened in a cool place. The chutney will keep for 4-6 weeks.

recipes.title: Roast pork chops with maple syrup and green peppercorns

instructions.text: Mix together the peppercorns, maple syrup, half the olive oil and paprika in a large bowl. Place the chops in the bowl and leave to marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours or for as long as possible.

Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4. Heat the remaining oil in an ovenproof frying pan and seal the pork for about 1 minute on each side. Use tongs to hold the chops and seal the fat on the side for about 1 minute. Pour the marinade over the chops and place the pan in the oven. Cook for about 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, put the apples in a small saucepan with 3 tablespoons of water and cook over a medium heat, stirring until they make a soft pulp. Remove from the heat and leave to cool slightly, then add the mustard and season with salt and pepper.
Cook the spinach in boiling salted water, drain thoroughly and place in a bowl. Dress with extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice, season with salt and mix well.
Place a pork chop in the centre of each plate, drizzle over the hot marinade, and serve with spinach and apple sauce on the side.

ingredients.text: 4 good quality eggs, 2 reserved for egg wash
200 g wild boar or venison mince

instructions.text: Soft boil 2 of the eggs for 5 minutes, then plunge in ice water.
Peel the eggs. Roll in flour and then gently wrap the mince around them so they are covered in the meat (1cm thick).
Roll the eggs in flour, egg wash and then through the breadcrumbs, ensuring they're covered entirely.
Heat the oil to 180C and carefully place the eggs in the oil and cook for 6 minutes, or until golden.
Remove and drain on kitchen paper.
Serve with pickled onions.
Cut the tomatoes in half and set aside.
In a heavy bottom pan, heat the oil and add all the spices and sizzle for a couple of minutes.
In a bowl, mix the sugar with the vinegar and stir well to dissolve the sugar.
Add this to the pan and bring to a simmer, making sure all the sugar is mixed in.

Tip in the tomatoes and cook on a very low heat until all the tomatoes have softened and the consistency is thick. This should take about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Season with salt and stir frequently to keep it from sticking on the bottom.
Cool the chutney and empty into a sterilised jar. Store for 4-6 weeks.

recipes.title: Irish cream bread and butter pudding

ingredients.text: ½ loaf of white farmhouse bread, sliced
6 tbsp Irish cream liqueur, such as Baileys
Clotted cream and icing sugar, to serve

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4. Butter a 1.5 litre ovenproof dish.
Spread the bread slices with the remaining butter on both sides. Cut the bread into triangles and overlap the layers of bread with the sultanas in the greased dish.
Beat the egg yolks, whole eggs, and sugar together in a large bowl until creamy. Beat in the cream, milk, vanilla extract and Irish cream.
Pour the mix over the bread, and press down the bread slices with your fingers until they are submerged. Leave to stand for 20 minutes, so the bread soaks up the custard.
Place the dish in a larger dish, half-filled with water. Sprinkle the top with Demerara sugar and bake for 35-40 minutes, until golden.
A few minutes before removing the pudding from the oven, warm up the jam in a small pan until runny then with a pastry brush, dab the jam glaze over the pudding.
Leave to stand and cool slightly before serving with a spoonful of clotted cream and a dusting of icing sugar.

recipes.title: Simple succulent turkey schnitzel with easy egg fried rice

ingredients.text: 2x 150 g turkey breast slices, flattened slightly

instructions.text: Heat a wok and add the 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
Add the beaten eggs and mix well until the egg is cooked and dry, this is the secret.
Add a little salt and pepper and the rice and warm through, moving the rice all the time.
Cook for 3-4 minutes then keep warm.
Heat the 4 tablespoons of oil and add the butter, heat until foaming (the butter will help brown the breadcrumbs).
Lightly flour the turkey breast fillet, then add to the beaten egg and then into the breadcrumbs, patting down so the crumbs stick well.
Add the crumbed slices to the hot oil and butter and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until cooked then drain well on kitchen towel.
Finally saut√© the spring onions and pepper for a couple of minutes to soften, season well with salt and pepper.
To serve, place the fried rice onto a warm plate and top with the cooked schnitzel. Finally add the saut√©ed peppers and onions. Squeeze a little lemon over to finish.

ingredients.text: Juice of 1 large orange or 4 tbsp fresh orange juice
Ice cream or Greek yoghurt, to serve

instructions.text: Soak the apricots in 700ml of water and the orange juice overnight. Drain the liquid from the apricots and measure 300ml into a saucepan. Arrange the apricots in a sterilised jar.

Make a light syrup by dissolving the sugar in the drained liquid. Bring to the boil for 2 minutes, then cool. Add the brandy to the syrup and pour over the fruit, making sure that all the fruit is covered.
Seal, cool and store in a cool place for 3 weeks before using.

ingredients.text: 4 apples, such as Granny Smith, peeled and sliced to 1.5cm thickness

instructions.text: Combine the apple, syrup, sugar and butter in a sauce pan. Cook on a medium heat until the apples are just cooked and add salt, to taste.
Once the sweet potatoes are baked, peel off the skins and slice into rounds, the same thickness as your apples.
Layer the potatoes and apples in a baking dish, alternating as you go.
Top with the optional walnuts and some small cubes of butter. For added crunch, sprinkle some demerara sugar over the top as well which will caramelise during cooking.
Bake in the oven at 160C/Gas 2 for about 20-30 minutes. Serve warm.

ingredients.text: 2 large potatoes, peeled and roughly cubed
2 large onions, peeled and roughly chopped
200 g fine green beans, chopped into 1cm pieces
Salt and freshly milled black pepper
200 g fresh crab meat, picked well

instructions.text: Place a pan on the stove. Add the water, stock cubes, potatoes, onions, garlic, beans & sweetcorn. Season well with salt and pepper.
Cook for 30 minutes until the spuds are cooked and just falling apart. When cooked add the milk, crab, coriander and re-heat.
Serve with plenty of chopped parsley sprinkled on top.

ingredients.text: 2 medium potatoes, boiled in their skins, then chopped into small cubes
Salt and freshly milled black pepper

instructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a frying pan.
Add the pancetta and cook for 5 minutes.
Next, add the onion and cook for a further 2 minutes.
Beat the eggs with a little salt and pepper.
Add the potatoes and peas and mix well.
Pour the egg into the frying pan and cook over a medium heat until set.
Sprinkle with a little cheese and place under a hot grill and finish the top, do not over cook!

ingredients.text: 1 Scotch bonnet pepper, sliced (de-seed if you don't want it too hot!)
¼ cup yellow split peas (soak in boiling water about an hour before cooking)

instructions.text: Carefully wash and chop the chicken into bite size pieces and season with salt.
Blend the garlic, celery and leaves, coriander and a piece of scotch bonnet to taste.
Rub the blended mixture onto the chicken along with the soy sauce, ketchup, black pepper and tomatoes. Marinate for about 20 minutes.

Next, wash and chop the vegetables. Heat a non stick pot and add the sunflower oil then put in the brown sugar. Let that caramelise then throw in the chicken and stir it around on a medium heat so the chicken is coated all over.
Cook for about 3 minutes, stirring continuously, then add the vegetables and the soaked split peas. Let that cook for a minute or two then pour over enough water to just cover everything.
Put in the okra and thyme and add a bit of salt to flavour. Leave that to simmer until everything is cooked and serve.

ingredients.text: Crusty bread (can use gluten or wheat-free bread) and butter, to serve

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a pan and add the chopped onion. Gently fry until soft and golden for a few minutes.
Add chopped peppers and ginger and coat in the melted butter. Add the tomatoes, tomato pur√©e, vegetable stock, sugar and seasoning and bring to a bubbling simmer for 10 minutes.
Check seasoning and add more if required. Using a hand blender, blitz for a couple of minutes (depending on required texture). Serve warm with crusty bread and butter!
Place the flour, sugar and salt in a bowl, mix well.
Add the egg and milk and bring together with a wooden spoon.
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a non-stick frying pan and add 2-3 spoons of mixture to the pan. Let the mixture run in the pan.
After 2 minutes, flip over with a spatula and cook for a further 2 minutes. Repeat the process until all the mixture is cooked.
Grill the bacon until nice and crispy.
Serve the warm pancakes topped with the bacon and drizzle with runny honey and serve.

ingredients.text: 7-8 bananas, peeled and sliced into large pieces
Pinch of freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4.
Cook the banana pieces in the butter until they start to caramelise then add the rum (if using), raisins and flamb√©. Add a twist of black pepper then place into an oven proof dish.

Next make the batter. Sift the flour into a mixing bowl and rub in the butter until it resembles breadcrumbs. Mix in the sugar and salt. Stir in the beaten egg then add the milk one tablespoon at a time, mixing until it resembles a thick batter.

Make the toffee sauce: add the butter, sugar and double cream into a pan and bring to the boil. Pour over the bananas. Dot 6-8 tablespoons of the batter on top of the bananas making sure they don't touch. Scatter over the chopped walnuts and bake in a preheated oven for 35 minutes or until golden. Serve warm.

ingredients.text: 90 g caster sugar, plus extra to sprinkle over the fruit
200 g beetroot (you can use cooked, but not pickled!)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 190C/Gas 5.
Rub the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs and then mix in the sugar.
For the filling, boil the beetroot for around 15 minutes until soft. Remove from the water and pur√©e until smooth
Add the beetroot pur√©e to the diced apples and cinnamon and add 2 tablespoons of sugar.

Put the filling into an oven proof dish with a few tablespoons of caster sugar. Spread the crumble mix on top of the fruit and bake in the oven for around 30-35 minutes or until golden on the top. Serve warm.

ingredients.text: 100 g butter, melted and 50g margarine, melted and combined. An extra 25g butter, for greasing
200 ml buttermilk (if you don't have buttermilk, increase milk to 475ml)

instructions.text: Mix together all of the ingredients in a large bowl. Pour into a pre-greased loaf tin (around 23cms in size would be ideal), then bake for 45 - 55 minutes or until golden brown on top (you can check if the bread is cooked through by inserting a knife in the middle ‚Äì it should come out clean.).
Remove and allow to cool by covering the loaf tin with a clean, damp cloth.
Once cooled, cut into slices and serve.
Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius/ 190 degrees Celsius fan/ gas mark 6.
Brown the lamb mince in a pan with a little oil.
In another pan, fry the aubergine for 2-3 minutes per side in a little oil, until golden. Parboil the sliced potatoes for 3-4 minutes and set aside.

Colour the onion and garlic for 5 minutes then add the browned lamb mince. Deglaze the pan the lamb was cooked in with the white wine and reduce by half, then add to the onion mix. Add the chopped tomatoes, stock, oregano and cinnamon and cook with a lid on for 15 minutes.
For the topping, whisk together the yoghurt, feta cheese and egg then grate in some nutmeg and season with pepper.

In an ovenproof dish, add a layer of mince then top with the par boiled potatoes, season then add another layer of mince. Layer over the aubergine, then top with the rest of the mince. Spread over the topping then cook in a pre-heated oven for 50 minutes. Leave to stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Serve with some garlic bread and salad leaves.

ingredients.text: 3 rashers slightly smoked bacon, finely chopped
5 Cox/Braeburn apples, cut into small cubes (skin on is fine)

instructions.text: Mix the flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl.
Cut the butter into cubes and cut into the flour before rubbing together with your fingertips.
Bring together with cold water to form a soft dough and refrigerate for around an hour.
First, sweat the onion in oil. Add the garlic, thyme and apples and sweat until the apples are soft but not falling apart.
Add the pork mince and fry briefly to slightly brown but not cook the meat (about a minute) Set aside to cool.

Roll out the dough to about a 2mm thickness and cut into disks using a small saucer. Place the cut disks on a floured plate and return to the fridge to firm up for around 15 minutes (this makes them a lot easier to fill).
In your hand place a disk, then a good amount of mixture in the middle, brush the edges with egg mixture, carefully fold over and crimp the edges.
Brush liberally with egg wash and place on a greased baking sheet.
Place in a preheated oven at 180C/Gas 4 for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.

ingredients.text: 4 your favourite white sustainable fish fillets such as cod, coley or pollack
A handful of green stuffed olives
Small pinch of salt and pepper, to taste
200 g raw brown basmati rice, cooked according to packet instructions
A small handful of steamed broccoli, per person

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4.
Cut 2 pieces of baking parchment (or foil if you don‚Äôt have parchment) to twice the size of 2 fillets.

Lay two fillets on each of the pieces of parchment and scatter the sliced peppers, lemon zest and olives over them. Season to taste (don‚Äôt forget the olives might be quite salty so a small pinch will do!). Drizzle with olive oil.

Bring the edges of the parchment together and fold over so the parcels are properly sealed and place on a baking tray in the oven for 15-20 minutes. Serve with brown basmati rice and steamed broccoli.
Put the lamb with the rosemary, mint, vinegar, honey, salt and pepper in a bowl. Cover with cling film and place in the fridge for about 4 hours to marinate.
Heat the olive oil in a large cast-iron casserole dish and fry the onions, mushrooms, celery and potatoes for about 5 minutes, stirring continuously with a wooden spoon.
Add the lamb steaks along with the marinade, mix well and cook uncovered for a further 5 minutes, stirring.
Add the wine and cook for about 2 minutes to allow the alcohol to evaporate and add the chopped tomatoes.
Add the water, season with salt and pepper, cover the casserole with a lid and cook over a low heat for about 1.5 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve warm with a scoop of cheesy mashed potatoes.

ingredients.text: 1 vanilla pod, cut into 4 and split
4 apples (such as Rubens, Cox or Braeburn)
200 g puff pastry (rolled out .5cm thick and cut 1.5
25 ml apple brandy, such as Calvados

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius/gas mark 6.
Place the sugar and butter into a pan along with the split vanilla pods, star anise, mixed spice and cloves.
Core the apples using an apple corer, then peel and halve. Arrange the halved apples with the flat side facing up on top of the butter and sugar in the pan.
Cover with puff pastry, making sure to tuck the puff pastry down the edges of the pan. Prick the pastry to create 4-5 small holes and allow to rest for 10-15 minutes.

Place onto the stove and cook until the sugar goes a golden brown caramel colour around the edges, this should take around 10 minutes. Keep an eye on the pan at this stage as you don‚Äôt want it to burn.
Place into a preheated oven until the puff pastry is golden brown, for approximately 20 minutes.
To make the caramel sauce, place the sugar and water into a thick bottomed pan until the sugar is dissolved, then turn up the heat and boil for 4-5 minutes until golden.
Remove from the heat, add the apple brandy, then the butter and cream to create the sauce.
Turn out of the pan and serve warm with the caramel and some pouring cream.

recipes.title: Bramley apple, watercress, chestnut and thyme stuffing

ingredients.text: 1 small onion, peeled and finely chopped
1 Bramley apple, peeled, cored and grated
150 g chestnuts, peeled and left whole
Salt and freshly milled black pepper

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the onions, garlic and thyme then cook for a few minutes until soft and translucent. Add the sausage meat and stir well. Just break down the sausage meat but do not actually cook it through.

Then cool slightly, add enough breadcrumbs to stiffen up the mixture, but remember that they will continue to thicken as they reconstitute themselves so take care not too add too many. Then stir in the whole egg, watercress and beat the whole mixture well.
Finally add the chestnuts and some salt and pepper.

ingredients.text: 4 medium sea bass or sea bream fillets, cut into 4cm slices
½ preserved lemon, skin peeled and cut into slivers (can use regular lemon if you can't find this)
A handful of chopped parsley or coriander, for garnish
200 g raw couscous, cooked according to packet instructions

instructions.text: Mix the marinade ingredients together in a bowl then spread evenly over the fish pieces. Place the fish pieces in a dish and marinate overnight, or if there isn‚Äôt time, for as long as you can before cooking.
Pre heat the oven to 200C/Gas 6.
To make the sauce, heat the oil and fry the onions, garlic and spices until softened. Pour in the tomatoes and simmer uncovered until the sauce has thickened, stirring frequently.

Put the pieces of marinated fish into the bottom of a tagine or ovenproof casserole dish, and pour over the tomato sauce. Bring to a simmer on top of the stove. (Be sure to use a heat diffuser under the dish if or heat the dish first in the oven.) Sprinkle the preserved lemon pieces and the black olives on top, cover and cook in the oven for about 30-45 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.
Garnish with chopped coriander or parsley and serve with couscous and salad.

ingredients.text: Handful of salad leaves, rocket or spinach
1 tbsp pumpkin seeds (optional, but they are so good for you!)
2 tbsp reduced fat hummus, to serve

instructions.text: Bake the sweet potato, prick with a fork first. Either bake in the microwave according to your manufacturer‚Äôs instructions or in the oven for around 20 minutes at 180C/Gas 4.
Assemble the salad. Mix together the dressing in a bowl and pour over the salad. Spoon the hummus onto the baked potato and serve with the salad.

ingredients.text: 1 kg potatoes (King Edward are best), peeled

instructions.text: Put the potatoes ina large saucepan, cover with cold water and bring to the boil. Cook until tender. Drain and mash in the saucepan.

Return the pan to a low heat and use a wooden spoon to stir in the milk and beat to a creamy texture. Add in the cheeses, the butter, season with salt and pepper and continue to stir for a further 3 minutes over a low heat until the cheeses are completely melted. Serve immediately.

ingredients.text: 3 sausages (Sleeping Warrior, or any good deli smoked sausage)

instructions.text: Wash thoroughly and then boil the seaweed in some water for 30 minutes.
Heat some oil in a wok and cook the onions and garlic before adding a little ginger.
Add some sliced sausage.
Then add the pre-cooked seaweed and stir for a few minutes ‚Äì don‚Äôt cook it for too long.
Add a small amount of soya sauce before finally putting in some pre-cooked prawns.
Top off with some chopped coriander before serving immediately.

recipes.title: Pork and pistachio kebabs with oregano pesto

ingredients.text: 5 cm fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated
2 green chillies, de-seeded and finely chopped

instructions.text: Preheat the grill to medium/high.
Mix the pork in a bowl with the eggs, ginger, chillies, cumin, onion and pistachios. Knead to combine really well, then shape into 16 small kebabs.
Grill the kebabs for at least 3 minutes on each side, until golden and cooked right through.
Serve with mini pitta breads with the pesto to dip in the kebabs which will be on skewers. Serve with a green salad on the side.
Place all the ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth. Season and add the parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Salt and pepper beef with mustard pan sauce

instructions.text: To cook the steaks, heat a large non-stick frying pan until hot. Rub the rump steaks all over with the olive oil and season well with freshly ground black pepper and sea salt.

Place the steaks in the hot pan and cook for approximately 5-6 minutes in total, turning over each minute until medium rare or 1-2 minutes longer depending on thickness, if you prefer your meat well done.

Lift the steaks out of the pan and place on a plate. Cover lightly with foil and set to one to side to rest while you make the sauce. Reduce the heat under the frying pan, add the chives and butter to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
Pour in the wine and boil for 30 seconds. Stir in the cream and mustard. Bring to the boil and simmer for 1/2 minutes. Season to taste.

recipes.title: Grandma Tyrer‚Äôs rabbit and bacon pie

instructions.text: First you need to boil your rabbits for one and a half hours and then remove from the pan, saving the liquid they were cooked in.
Leave to cool and then take the meat off the bones.
Next chop some carrots, place them in the stock the rabbits were cooked in and boil for 10 minutes.
In a separate pan, fry up some chopped bacon with shallots and mushrooms.
Add one stock cube to the stock and stir in. Add some flour to thicken it up and then a little browning to add colour.
Put the rabbit, bacon, shallots and mushrooms into a large oven dish and pour over the gravy.
Roll out the pastry and cover the pie dish.
Put the dish into a warmed oven at 190C for 30 minutes. Cover it with foil and cook for a further 30-40 minutes.
Whilst the pie is in the oven, peel and parboil your potatoes and place in a roasting tray with butter, garlic and rosemary. Cook for about 30 to 40 minutes until crisp and golden.
Now it‚Äôs time to serve up Grandma Tyrer‚Äôs rabbit and bacon pie with the roast potatoes and seasonal vegetables.

recipes.title: Grandma Farcha‚Äôs Iraqi Jewish sabich vegetarian pitta

instructions.text: The night before:
Place eggs and potatoes in a slow cooker, along with water and the skin from an onion. Leave cooking for about 15 hours.
Soak the dried chickpeas in water so that they‚Äôll be rehydrated for use the next day.

Mix 1 cup of white flour, 1 tablespoon of dried yeast, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 3 tablespoons of olive oil and 1 cup of warm water in a bowl until the mixture is smooth. Leave dough to rest for about 10 minutes at room temperature.
In a second bowl combine 2 cups of white flour, 3 tablespoons of olive oil and about 1 tablespoon of salt. Mix together with the dough that has been resting until smooth.
Flour the dough and leave in bowl. Cover the bowl with a towel and let it rise for another 45 minutes to an hour.
Once risen, divide the dough into 8 and leave for a further 45 minutes to an hour. Roll each of the pieces of dough into a flat pitta.
Place the pittas into a preheated oven at 240C and bake for 7-10 minutes until they are a nice tan colour.
Drain the chickpeas that have been soaking overnight and rinse them. Place into a pot and cover with water to about 5cm above the top of the peas and bring to the boil.
Once boiling, reduce the heat and leave them to cook for 45 minutes until they have slightly softened.
Add bicarbonate of soda to the chickpeas and cook until the grains have softened completely.

Once cooked, leave the chickpeas to one side to cool, saving the water from the pan. After the chickpeas have cooled put them into a food processor and blend them, adding garlic, tahini, salt, lemon and parsley.
Add water from the pan until the desired consistency has been achieved.
Leave the hummus to one side until ready for use.
Cut the aubergine into slices of about one centimetre in thickness, sprinkle with salt and leave to drain for about 2 hours.
Once the aubergine has drained, heat some vegetable oil in a deep pan until it is very hot. Put the slices of aubergine into the oil and fry until each slice looks golden on each side.
Remove slices from the oil and dry off on kitchen paper.
Leave the aubergine to dry off on the paper until ready for use.
For the eggs and potatoes:
Remove the eggs and potatoes from the slow cooker where they have been cooking overnight.
Peel and chop into slices ready for use.

Take one of the pitta breads and slice open. Place as much potato, eggs, hummus, pickles and aubergine as required into the pita. Serve with a traditional Iraqi salad of sliced tomatoes, flat leaf parsley, pepper, red onions, spring onions and mint.

recipes.title: Creamed oyster broth with scallops and sole

ingredients.text: 1 bouquet garni (a sprig of thyme, 2-3 parsley stalks, ¬Ω bay leaf and a small piece of celery)

instructions.text: Fillet the sole and gurnard and remove the skin from each of the fillets. Wash the fish bones to remove any blood. Clean out the fish heads, removing the eyes and gills.

Then make the fish reduction that will form the base of the broth. Melt a little butter in a heavy based saucepan. Add in the fish bones and heads and crush them down with a wooden spoon. Cook for 5-10 minutes, allowing the flavours to develop from the bones. Add in the white wine and allow this to reduce down until nearly all the wine has evaporated.
Pour in the water and add in the bouquet garni and peppercorns. Bring to the boil and simmer for 20 minutes, skimming often.
Strain the stock into a clean pan.
Open the oysters, drain off the juice and stir it into the fish broth. Stir in the cream and season well.
Slice the scallops in half horizontally and cut the fillets of fish into bite size pieces.

Melt a good knob of butter in a large frying pan. When it is foaming, add the fish and gently poach the fish in the butter for a minute or two, until very lightly cooked. Place a selection of the scallops, sole and gurnard in the bottom of each bowl and scatter over a tablespoon of shredded basil.
Gently reheat the creamy fish broth and ladle over fish. Serve immediately.
Peel the bananas and potatoes with a knife.
Put the potatoes and bananas and 1 litre of water in a large saucepan. Cook until soft and then mash.

Peel and chop the onion. Put in a frying pan, add the olive oil and fry until brown then put the goat in. Chop the tomatoes and put them in with the meat. Cook until soft then add the black and pepper royco mchuzi and cook until soft. Add 1/4 litres of water and simmer until ready.
Chop the cabbage, put in the pan and steam gently until soft.

recipes.title: Toffee apple bread and butter pudding

ingredients.text: 30 g butter, plus extra for greasing
8 slices of cherry and almond cake
Small handful of fresh mint leaves

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C/Gas 4.

Melt the butter in a large frying pan. Add the apples, 60g sugar and lemon juice and cook over a high heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar. When the apples turn golden and caramelised, take the pan off the heat.

Scatter most of the apple pieces in the base of four individual buttered baking dishes (keeping a few for decoration). Crumble the cake into bite-size pieces, then scatter these amongst the apple in the dishes.
Whisk together the eggs, egg yolks and the rest of the sugar. Bring the milk, cream and vanilla pod up to the boil in a medium pan.
Gradually pour this over the egg mix, whisking all the time to prevent any lumps forming. Let this cool for a minute or two, then pour this over the apple and cake.
Let the dishes stand for 20 minutes so the cake can absorb some of the custard.
Place the pudding dishes in a bain-marie and transfer the puddings to the oven. Cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the custard is set and golden.
Meanwhile make the raspberry sauce. Blitz the raspberries and icing sugar in a blender. Pass the sauce through a sieve to remove the pips, then pour it into a serving jug.

Take the puddings out of the oven and allow to settle for a few minutes. Sprinkle each one generously with demerara sugar, then place them under a hot grill to caramelise the surface of the puddings (this could also be done using a blowtorch).
Dot the remaining caramelised apple around each serving plate with a few leaves of fresh mint and serve with a jug of raspberry sauce.

ingredients.text: 1 carrot, peeled and cut in half

instructions.text: Bring a large pan of water up to the boil. Add the onion, celery and carrot, then carefully place the duck in the pan. Simmer gently for 30-40 minutes, then remove the duck and place on a trivet in a roasting tray.
Preheat the oven to 200C/Gas 6.

Pat the duck dry, then rub the skin with a little olive oil. Stuff a handful of rosemary and sage into the duck‚Äôs cavity. Season the duck well, then roast for 40 minutes until the skin is really crispy, or according to your taste. Allow to rest for 15 minutes.

Drain any excess fat from the roasting pan, then place it over a high heat. Add the wine and a sprig of rosemary to deglaze the pan. Allow the wine to reduce by two-thirds, then add in the 200ml stock from the poaching pan, skimmed of fat. Let this bubble away until you have a thin sauce consistency (reduce by at least half). Just before serving, whisk in 50g butter to make a glossy jus.

Meanwhile make the cauliflower cheese. Cut the cauliflower into medium florets, then blanch them in salted boiling water until just tender. Drain, then gently squeeze any excess liquid from each floret.

Melt the butter in a medium saucepan, then stir in the flour to make a roux. Cook this for a few minutes to remove the raw flavour of the flour, then stir in the mustard powder and some seasoning. Gradually whisk in the milk, little by little until you have a smooth, creamy sauce. Cook over a medium heat for a few more minutes to allow the sauce to thicken.
Stir in the grated cheese, keeping a little back for sprinkling over the top of the cauliflower. Check the seasoning.

Spoon a little cheese sauce into the bottom of 4-6 individual, oven-proof dishes. Arrange some cauliflower florets in each, then cover with some more cheese sauce. Scatter the top of each dish with the remaining cheese, then bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes, until golden.

Peel and cut the parsnips into quarters. Remove the woody core from each quarter, then toss the parsnips in olive oil. Spread them out on a roasting tray, season with salt and roast for 30-40 minutes, until tender.
Boil the potatoes until tender, the cut each one in half lengthways. Shred the spring cabbage and then steam lightly. Toss both the potatoes and cabbage in a little butter and seasoning.

Remove legs from the duck, and carve each portion into two. Next remove the breasts of the duck and cut each one into four pieces. Serve the duck on a bed of buttered potatoes and cabbage, next to a dish of golden cauliflower cheese and some roast parsnips. Drizzle some red wine sauce over the duck.

ingredients.text: 350 g puy lentils, soaked overnight in water
1 head of broccoli, cut into small florets
Pinch of crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
600 g skinless boned salmon fillets, sliced into 2cm thick pieces
Small handful of baby coriander, chopped

instructions.text: Drain the soaked lentils. Bring a large pan of salted water to the boil, add the lentils and boil. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes until cooked (the lentils should be soft). Remove from the heat and drain in a fine sieve. Set aside.
Blanch the broccoli by placing in boiling salted water for 6 minutes, then drain.

Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick pan over a low heat, add the garlic and cook for 1 minute until softened but not coloured. Add the lentils to the pan with the dark soy sauce, balsamic vinegar and Worcestershire sauce. Add the blanched broccoli florets and cook stirring over a medium heat for 4 minutes.

Season to taste with crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper and keep warm in the pan on a low heat whilst you cook the salmon. Heat a large non-stick frying pan and add a splash of olive oil. Season the salmon pieces and lay away from yourself into the pan. Sear for 1 minute only on both sides then squeeze over the lemon juice and remove from the pan - the lemon juice continues to cook the salmon and it is best served pink inside.
Add a pile of lentils to a plate, lay some salmon on top and scatter over the coriander.

recipes.title: Roasted lamb shank in red wine sauce

ingredients.text: 3 sprigs of fresh thyme, plus 4 more for decoration
1 bottle of good quality red wine
3 red onions (peeled and cut into quarters)
100 g sundried tomatoes in oil (finely chopped)
Salt and white pepper to taste

instructions.text: In a large casserole dish place the lamb shanks, carrot, white onion, herbs and peppercorns. Pour over the wine, cover and leave to marinate in a cool place for 5 hours. Stir every hour.

When ready, place the casserole dish on the heat and bring to the boil. Cover with the lid and cook in a preheated oven at 190C for 2 hours. Slightly un-cover the lid for the second hour allowing the sauce to slightly thicken.

Remove the dish from the oven, take the lamb shanks out of the cooking liquid and place in a roasting dish. Spoon over 4 ladlefuls of the liquid to keep the meat moist and add the red onions around it.
Place the lamb back into the oven and roast for 25 to 30 minutes or until the meat starts to fall off the bone. Baste occasionally.
Strain the remaining liquid into a small saucepan and on a low heat reduce by half its volume. Once ready, add in the redcurrant jelly and stir until melted.
Meanwhile, prepare the mash. Peel the potatoes and cut into quarters. Cook in a large saucepan with plenty of salted boiling water until tender. Once ready, drain well and allow to slightly cool.

Press the potatoes through a ricer back into the saucepan, add in the milk and take back to a slow heat. Stir continuously with a wooden spoon for 3 minutes. Add in the butter, cheese and sundried tomatoes and continue to stir for a further 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve a generous spoonful of the mashed potatoes in the middle of a serving plate, place the lamb shank on top and drizzle with the delicious redcurrant jelly sauce.
Decorate with a sprig of fresh thyme and serve immediately.

ingredients.text: 300 g self-raising flour, seasoned with salt and pepper
1 tsp dried Italian herbs (or use fresh ‚Äì e.g. thyme)
175 g grated hard continental cheese ‚Äì e.g. Comte (or you can use cheddar instead)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/Gas 4. Place 24 paper muffin cases in two muffin tins.
Place the tomatoes in a food processor and whizz up until chopped and small (or use kitchen scissors). Then do the same with the olives and green beans.
Sift the flour into a large bowl. Stir through the herbs and cheese. Add the eggs, milk, olive oil plus the tomatoes, olives and green beans. Stir firmly but gently to combine.
Divide evenly between the cases (an ice cream scoop is perfect for this) and bake for 25 minutes.
Leave the muffins in their cases (in the tin) for a good half an hour or more to cool down and firm up.

ingredients.text: 2 tbsp of kecap manis or dark soy sauce
Zest and juice of 1 large orange
200 g trimmed spring onions cut in half across
60 g (small handful of matchstick cut carrot)
1 large courgette cut into 2 cm thick slices

instructions.text: First slice the chicken breasts into thin strips. Place in a bowl with the orange zest and juice and soy, mix together, cover with cling film and marinade for 30 minutes.
Next, heat a wok or large non-stick pan, drain off the marinated chicken reserving the liquid. Stir-fry the chicken in a splash of sesame oil and cook for two minutes.
Add the courgette slices, garlic, chilli and spring onion pieces. Continue to cook for a further 3 minutes, moving constantly, then add the carrot and noodles.
Pour over the reserved marinade and add the 2 tbsp of water. Heat the noodles through, add the coriander and arrange the stir fry in a serving dish.
Sprinkle over the toasted sesame seeds and a drizzle of sesame oil and garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

ingredients.text: 800 g chicken breasts/ thighs skinless and boneless, cut into 3 cm cubes

instructions.text: To make the pepper masala, grind together in a coffee grinder the freshly ground pepper, the cardamom, the cloves and the cinnamon.
Mix the ground pepper masala, ginger, garlic, turmeric, vinegar and the salt in a bowl along with the chicken. Leave to marinate for approximately 2-3 hours.

Heat the oil in a deep pan to a medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and as soon as they crackle add the bay leaves, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom pods, and the black peppercorns. Add the sliced onions and fry until half cooked, then add the chopped tomato and continue to fry until golden brown.
Add the marinated chicken and saut√© for a few minutes to allow the natural juices to evaporate.
Add just enough water (approximately 150ml) to cook the chicken. Bring to the boil and reduce the heat and braise the chicken for approximately 15 minutes, uncovered.
When almost cooked, add more salt if needed and the coriander.
Finally add the slit green chillies to garnish.

recipes.title: Slow-roasted lamb with broccoli and saut√©ed new potatoes

ingredients.text: 4 onions, peeled and cut in half
Crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
500 g pre-boiled new potatoes, skin on and sliced in half
A knob of butter and a splash of oil for saut√©ing
400 g trimmed new season purple sprouting broccoli

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/gas mark 6. Rub the lamb with olive oil and season with crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper.

Place the lamb in a heavy-based roasting tin with the onion and roast for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and drain off any fat. Add the thyme sprigs and the garlic. Reduce the oven temperature to 130C/275F/gas mark 1. Return the lamb to the oven. Cover the tin tightly with foil and cook for 4 and 1/2 hours.

Pour the vinegar and honey into a pan and bring to the boil over a medium heat. Add the wine and stock and bring to a simmer. Remove the roasting tin from the oven and pour the hot stock over the lamb. Return the lamb to the oven to cook for a further hour.

Take the new potato halves and simply saut√© in oil and a knob of butter until golden on the cut sides. Season and drain on kitchen towel before you serve. Blanch the purple sprouting broccoli in salted water for 3 minutes then drain and serve.
Pull the lamb off the bone and arrange on plates with onion, garlic cloves and tray juices and add a pile of saut√©ed new potatoes and blanched broccoli.

ingredients.text: 400 g plain flour, put in the fridge for 15 minutes before using
550 ml very cold beer, preferably a lager
4x 170 g pieces of sustainable line caught haddock (approximately)
1 Maris Piper potatoes, peeled and cut into chips
A small handful of fresh mint, leaves picked and chopped
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
A splash of vegetable stock or water

instructions.text: Heat the fat in a deep-fat fryer or chip pan to 185C.
Whisk the baking powder into the chilled flour, along with 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and quickly whisk in the cold beer utnil you have a thick batter. Allow this to rest for about an hour before use.

Position the bowl next to the fryer or pan. Have a plate lined with kitchen paper ready on the side. Dip your fish into the batter and then carefully lower it into the hot oil, shaking the fryer basket to keep the fish from sticking to it. This will also give the batter a more interesting texture. Do this one or two pieces at a time, don't overcrowd!
Cook the fish for about 5 minutes or until it is crisp and golden. Lift out of the fat, drain on kitchen paper and season with salt. Serve immediately.
Put the chips into a bowl under running water for 5 minutes, to wash the starch off.
Cover the potatoes with cold water in a pan. Place the pan over a medium heat and simmer until the chips are cooked all the way through (approximately 20-30 minutes, depending on the potato).
Carefully remove the cooked chips and place them on a cooling rack to dry.

Heat a deep-fat fryer or a deep pan no more than half full with oil, to 130C. Fry the chips in small batches for approximately 5 minutes, remove from the oil and drain on kitchen paper. Put the potatoes on a cooling rack for about 1 hour.
Heat the oil in the deep-fat fryer or deep pan up to 180C and fry the chips until golden. Drain and sprinkle with salt.

In a small saucepan, heat the stock or water with the butter to a simmer. Then add the peas and cook until they are soft. Add the chopped mint and using a fork or potato masher, squash the peas until mushy. Finish with a squeeze of lemon and season to taste.
Make a mayonnaise by mixing the egg yolks, Dijon mustard and a little salt and black pepper. Slowly whisk in the oils, a little at a time.
Add the tarragon, capers, gherkins and parsley.
Thin the sauce down a bit with the lemon juice. Adjust the seasoning and serve with your fish and chips!

ingredients.text: 100 g split yellow peas, soaked overnight (simply place in a bowl and cover with cold water)
1 large sweet potato, peeled and roughly chopped

instructions.text: Drain the split peas and rinse them through with cold water. Set aside.

In a large saucepan, heat the oil. Saut√© the onion, garlic and cumin for a couple of minutes. Add the potato, carrots, split peas and stock. Simmer rapidly for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Transfer to a blender and blitz until smooth. Taste and add any seasoning you want to ‚Äì or extra spice. Feel free to loosen slightly with a bit of extra stock.
Place the red wine in a pan, bring to the boil and cook for 1 minute to burn off the alcohol.
Then add the stock, peppercorns, red wine vinegar and sugar and simmer rapidly until you are left with about a 1/4 to 1/3 of the original volume.
Season well with salt and pepper and add the double cream, warm through. Taste and readjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve warm poured over a big juicy steak!

ingredients.text: 1 1.5-2kg leg of lamb, bone removed butterflied so that all the meat is 1.5 inch in thickness (you can ask your butcher to do this)
1 small bunch of fresh thyme, chopped
1 clove of smoked garlic, or regular if you can't find it
A couple glugs of olive oil, to make a thick paste

instructions.text: If your butcher has not removed the bone and butterflied the lamb leg for you, do that before you begin. With a sharp knife cut around the bone, as close as you can get so as not to lose too much meat. Then use small cuts to butterfly the meat out into a flat piece that is 1.5 inches in thickness.
Next, make the quick marinade for the lamb by combining in a bowl first the dry spices, the fresh herbs and a couple glugs of olive oil, only enough to make it a thick paste.
Then add in the salt, chilli, achovy paste and finally the honey.
Rub this marinade into the meat, all over each side. You can leave it to sit for a bit to marinate (up to 1 hour) or simply throw it on the barbecue right away.
On a medium heat barbecue, cook the lamb for about 10-15 minutes on each side, so that it's an even pink in the middle all the way through.
Slice and serve as is, or put some slices in a bap for a tasty sandwich.
Place the avocado and lime juice in a blender and whizz up until it‚Äôs a smooth puree.

Put the avocado-lime mix in a food processor with a whisk attachment (or use a handheld whisk) and add the double cream, caster sugar, and vanilla extract. Whisk on a medium-high setting for about 3 minutes.

Place in a freezable container for 3-4 hrs. (Any longer and it‚Äôs a bit hard to scoop out. This isn‚Äôt in itself a detriment to the recipe ‚Äì just remember to let it thaw slightly before serving for a creamier ‚Äòsoft scoop‚Äô effect).
Dip the top of ice cream cones in melted white chocolate and then sprinkle the chocolate with sugar sprinkles. Leave to dry (upside down) on parchment paper‚Ä¶.
Fold through shards of fresh mint at the very end of stage 2 ‚Äì then when it‚Äôs ready to serve, scoop into waffle cones and sprinkle with chopped pistachio nuts‚Ä¶

ingredients.text: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Simply mix all the ingredients together and lay out on cling film. Roll up into a log shape, chill well in the fridge until ready to use.
Cut and remove the cling film. Cut a small disc of the butter and place on top of a cooked steak.
Place the unopened tin of condensed milk in a pan and cover with water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 2 hours; make sure you keep topping it up with water so it doesn't boil dry.
Meanwhile, place the biscuits in a blender and whizz up until smooth. Melt the butter in a saucepan and then add the biscuit crumbs and mix together well.
Choose the dish in which you will be serving the pie and place the biscuit and butter mixture in to form the base, smoothing it on top. Place in the fridge to set - roughly 20 minutes should do.
Once set, spoon over the condensed milk and then slice up your bananas and layer them on top. Whisk up your double cream and place that on top of the bananas.
Finally, finish it off by grating the dark chocolate over the top. Enjoy!

ingredients.text: 2 medium raw beetroot (not the pre-packaged stuff)
2 tsp glucose syrup (this is readily available in the baking section of most large supermarkets)

instructions.text: the oven to 200C / Gas 6 / Fan 180C and loosely wrap each beetroot (unpeeled) in a bit of silver foil. Place on a baking tray and bake for 1 ‚Äì 1 ¬Ω hours until tender (check that a sharp knife goes through easily). Leave to cool.

Meanwhile, place the sugar and glucose syrup in a pan with 100ml water. On a medium-high heat, bring to the boil (don‚Äôt stir or touch it) then rapidly simmer for 5 minutes. Carefully transfer it to a large bowl to cool down at the same time as the beetroot.

Place the raspberries in a pan with the juice of half of lemon and cook down for a couple of minutes, stirring and squidging. Strain through a sieve to remove the pips if you wish (personally, I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶)

Peel the beetroot and then chop it up. You need about 250g of the cooked beetroot so weigh this out. Place in a food processor with a further 100ml water and whizz up until blended to a puree. Add the raspberries and whizz up again.

Add it to the sugar syrup mix and give it all a good stir through. Place in a sealed container and into the freezer for an hour. Then use a fork to thoroughly beat it down to a slush. Repeat twice again at one hour intervals (i.e. three times beat it with the fork) ‚Äì this helps create the right consistency. Then keep it in the freezer. Leave out for about 30 minutes before serving so it‚Äôs not too hard.

recipes.title: Steamed seabass with brill and sole

ingredients.text: 1 whole scaled and gutted seabass, roughly 900g in weight
1 thumb sized piece of ginger, sliced into matchsticks
10 small brill and sole fillets, a mixture of the two
1 small bunch of basil, finely chopped
1 small bunch of parsley, finely chopped
1 small bunch of mint, finely chopped
A few glugs of olive oil

instructions.text: Start by grabbing two large pieces of aluminium foil and place one on top of the other. Take your prepared seabass slash the skin (not too deep).
Rub in the chilli, ginger, spring onions and lime juice. Coat liberally with olive oil and season. Fold the foil over and seal the edges tightly.
Place this parcel on the barbecue and steam for 12-15 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the green sauce by simply combining all of the ingredients.
Place the brill and sole fillets on a hot griddle pan, or flat pan placed on the barbecue. Cook the fillets for 3 minutes on each side. Serve with some crusty bread and the green sauce spooned over.
Carefully remove the seabass parcel from the barbecue and open up. Spoon the green sauce over and serve!

ingredients.text: 1 medium raw beetroot (not the pre-packaged stuff)
800 ml pressed (cloudy) apple juice / freshly squeezed orange juice

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200C / Gas 6 / Fan 180C and loosely wrap the beetroot (unpeeled) in a bit of silver foil. Place on a baking tray and bake for 1 ‚Äì 1 ¬Ω hours until tender (check that a sharp knife goes through easily).
Leave to cool then peel away the skin and chop it down. Place in a blender / food processor with 100ml water and the agave syrup / honey and blend to a smooth puree.
Place crushed ice in 4 glasses, fill each with the apple / orange juice (to about two thirds of the way up) then spoon 2 tablespoons of the beetroot puree on top. Serve immediately.

ingredients.text: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Heat the vinegar and wine or water in a pan with the peppercorns and stalks. Bring to the boil and simmer rapidly until the liquid has reduced by half to 50ml.
Strain out the peppercorns and stalks then return the liquid to the pan and bring back to the boil.
Meanwhile, gently melt the butter in a pan.
Add the reduced liquid and bring to a rolling boil.
Place the egg yolks in a liquidiser and blitz, then gradually add the vinegar and butter mixture in a thin, steady stream, through the hole in the lid.
Pour the sauce into a bowl and leave for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. It wil thicken as it cools.
Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning, adding a squeeze of lemon juice, pinch of sugar (if necessary) and the chopped tarragon. Keep warm until serving.

recipes.title: Fried meat kebabs with coriander and yoghurt dip

ingredients.text: 750 g lean minced lamb from the leg
2 chopped green chillies or 1 tsp cayenne or red chilli powder
80 g coriander leaves, including the stalks, roughly chopped
Juice of 2 limes plus the zest of 1 lime

instructions.text: First put all the ingredients for the meat kebabs into a bowl and mix thoroughly. (This mixture can be left to marinate for an hour or overnight.)
Shape the meat mixture into approximately 4 cm patties on a tray and set aside.
Heat ghee or oil in a wide frying pan over a medium heat and shallow fry the patties for a couple of minutes on each side, until they are cooked through and have a slightly blackened crust.
Serve with yogurt and coriander dip.
