Put all the above ingredients into a blender/food processor and blitz until smooth and runny. Remove and place into a bowl and adjust seasoning. Refrigerate until required.

ingredients.text: 1 perfectly ripe avocado (do the ‚Äòsqueeze‚Äô test ‚Äì not too hard, not too firm!)

instructions.text: Cut the avocado in half, lengthways and remove the stone with a teaspoon. Scoop out the soft flesh into a blender / smoothie maker.
Add everything else and whizz up!

recipes.title: Chocolate banana cake with peanut butter frosting

ingredients.text: 150 g self raising flour plus 1 extra tablespoon (for the bananas)
A few drops of whole milk

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180C and butter and dust a 20cm round or heart-shaped tin with flour.
Mash the bananas and coat them with one tablespoon of flour.
Melt the butter in a saucepan, add the chocolate and take off the heat.
When both the butter and chocolate are melted, add the bananas and stir until incorporated.
Beat the eggs and add them with the sugar and salt and mix. Add the flour, a third at a time. Do not over mix and stop stirring as soon as the mixture comes together.
Put the mixture into your tin and put into the oven for 45 - 55 minutes, depending on your oven. You may need to cover the top with tin foil after 25 minutes to stop it from over browning.

Your cake is done when a piece of uncooked spaghetti inserted into the middle of your cake comes out clean! Once the cake is completely cold you can ice it. You can make the icing in advance and keep it in the fridge until you need it.
Mix the peanut butter, cream cheese, vanilla, salt and half of the icing sugar. (It is important to do this by hand because the cream cheese can split and go watery if over mixed.)
Once mixed together, add the icing sugar a third at a time, followed each time by a drop of whole milk.
Taste the icing! Add more peanut butter if you like! (I like a really peanut buttery taste! Mmmmmm).
Mix until the icing sticks to the spoon but could be easily spread.
Using a palette knife, spread the icing across your cake and decorate with crushed flake bars and glitter!

ingredients.text: Chopped roasted almonds and pistachios, to decorate
1 pt Kent Strawberries, stalk removed and sliced

instructions.text: Make the jelly: Mix all the jelly ingredients together in a pan, and simmer over a low heat until the sugar has dissolved and the strawberries have become a pulp. Blend, then add the soaked gelatine leaves.

Now make the custard by combining the egg yolks, sugar and custard powder in a bowl. Bring the milk to the boil and pour over the egg mixture. Whisk together and return to the pan. Slowly cook the mixture over a low heat, stirring continuously until thick. Allow to cool.
Break up the sponge into thumb nail-size pieces and evenly spread into 6 serving glasses. Drizzle over the strawberry liquor.
Pour over the jelly, and place into the fridge to set for 1 hour.
Add the sliced strawberries, then spoon over the cooled custard, place back into the fridge for a further hour.
Whisk all the above cream ingredients together until soft peaks form.
Spoon the cream over the top and decorate with the chopped pistachios, almonds and chocolate shavings

recipes.title: Sweet potato and goats' cheese samosas

ingredients.text: 400 g sweet potato, cut into ¬æ cm cubes
200 g log/block of goats' cheese or feta cheese cut into ¬æ cubes
Rock salt and cinnamon to sprinkle on pastry

instructions.text: Place the potatoes into a saucepan covered with water and some salt. Bring to the boil and simmer for approximately 6-8 minutes until they become tender. Drain into a colander and allow to cool.
Add the goats' cheese, spring onions, coriander, fresh red chilli and crushed cumin. Lightly season with some salt and mix well. Set aside.
Pre-heat oven to 200C.

Melt 125g butter. Lay a sheet of filo pastry on a clear work surface and brush the sheet with melted butter. Place a second sheet on top to fit exactly over the first. Now cut the filo pastry into strips approximately 5cm wide, then spoon enough filling into one corner of the strip. Fold the right corner of the strip over to the left side to create a triangle. Continue to fold the triangle along the strip until you reach the end and cut off any surplus pastry.
Brush the samosas liberally with butter and sprinkle some rock salt and cinnamon on the top side of the samosas. Bake in the for approx 12-15 minutes, until pastry is cooked and golden.

ingredients.text: 4-6 gluten free sausages, cut into 1cm pieces
225 g basmati or long grain rice
600 ml strong chicken stock (use gluten free, reduced-salt stock cube or homemade stock)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 190C/Gas 5.
Heat the oil in a large flame-proof casserole dish and add the diced sausages. Cook for about 5 minutes until they just start to colour.

Remove the sausages from the pan, add the spices, chilli and curry powder and cook for 2 minutes to release their flavours. Add the onions, garlic and tomato puree and cook gently for about 5 minutes, until softened.

Stir in the rice and mix well with the other ingredients until coated. Add the wine, if using, and stock and return the sausages to the pan. Season well with pepper, then bring to the boil, stirring all the while.
Cover the casserole with a tight fitting lid or foil, and cook in the oven for 14-16 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
Remove from the oven and stir in the fresh coriander leaves. Cover and leave for a further 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 160C and grate the carrot, chop the nuts and cranberries, zest the orange and mix together in a bowl.
Sieve the dry ingredients together into a second bowl.
Whisk the wet ingredients in a measuring jug.
Fold the dry and wet ingredients together, then add in the carrot mix.
Put in lined 9" tin and cook for 1 hour and allow to cool completely before decorating.
Whisk the wet topping ingredients together.
Mix in enough icing sugar to get your desired consistency (Some like it slightly runny so that it oozes over the edges, but some might like it thicker).
Sprinkle chopped mixed nuts over the top.
Top with dried cranberries and red edible glitter.

ingredients.text: 1x 250 g pot of Quark soft cheese
1 packet of chocolate orange Options hot drink powder

instructions.text: Whisk together the Quark, fromage frais, sweetener, Options powder and grated zest from one of the oranges until well combined.
Cut the ends off the oranges and then set them on a chopping board. Using a sharp knife, remove the peel and pith and then cut the oranges into segments. Do this over a bowl to catch the juices.
Divide the orange segments and juice between 4 glasses and spoon over the chocolate mousse.
Chill in the fridge for at least 30 minutes, and dust lightly with cocoa powder just before serving.

ingredients.text: Finely grated zest of 2 unwaxed lemons

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (fan), 200¬∞C, gas mark 6. Line the bun tins with 20‚Äì24 paper cases. Using an electric whisk, beat the sugar and butter together till fluffy. Add the flour, baking powder, eggs, milk and lemon zest and fold it all together well.
Plop a dessertspoonful of the mix into each paper case in the bun tins and bake for 15‚Äì18 minutes till golden. Leave to cool completely.

For the icing, mix the sugar and the pulp of the passion fruit together till it‚Äôs thick and gloopy, and just dropping off the spoon. If you need to loosen it a touch use a drop or two of lemon juice. Dollop the icing on top of each cake and leave to set.

recipes.title: Pasta bake with pancetta, rosemary and pork

ingredients.text: 1 red onion, peeled and finely chopped

instructions.text: Heat 4 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large saucepan and fry the onion and carrot for 5 minutes until soft. Stir occasionally with a wooden spoon.
Add the pancetta with the minced pork and rosemary and continue to cook for a further 5 minutes, stirring continuously until coloured all over.
Pour in the tomatoes, season with salt and pepper and continue to cook over a medium heat for 15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Once ready set aside to allow the sauce to cool to room temperature.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and add to the meat sauce. Stir well and leave to cool.
Preheat the oven to 180C/fan 160C / gas mark 4.
Break the eggs into the saucepan of the cooled pasta and add in the grated Parmesan. Mix together.
Brush the remaining oil over the sides and base of a 22cm roundish nonstick baking dish with sides about 5cm deep. Pour in the pasta mixcture and spread out evenly.
Cook in the centre of the preheated oven for 20 minutes until crispy and set.
Once cooked, leave it to rest for 5 minutes. It will be easier to cut and serve as the layers will hold together. Serve hot or cold.

ingredients.text: 250 ml vegetable stock, homemade if possible
2 onions, 1 small dice and 1 cut into large chunks for stock (if making
1 leek, whites small dice and greens reserved for stock (if making)
1 large rainbow or regular carrot, small dice

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a pot or large saucepan.
Add in the chopped leek, garlic, carrot and onion and saute. Cook until softened, do not colour.
Add in the rice and stir to combine with the vegetables.
Keep stirring and add the 1/2 glass of wine. Let this simmer until it dissolves slightly and the alcohol has a chance to cook off.
Now begin adding the stock, 1 ladle at a time. Once the rice has absorbed the stock, add another ladle full. Keep on with this process until all the liquid is added.
When it's nearly done, blanch the purple sprouting broccoli in boiling salted water for 3-4 minutes.
Add in some sea salt and pepper to the risotto, to taste. Now also grate in a bit of parmesan cheese.
Once the broccoli is cooked, add it into the risotto and stir gently to combine. Place into bowls and top with a bit more parmesan over the top. Enjoy!

ingredients.text: 2 tbsp olive oil, plus extra for cooking
400 g runner beans, trimmed, stringed and sliced

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (fan), 200¬∞C, gas mark 6. Tear the bread into bite-sized pieces and toss in the oil with your hands. Bung in the oven for 10 minutes till crisp and golden. At the same time, lay the ham flat on a baking tray and roast for 10 minutes. Leave both to cool and crisp up.
For the dressing, squash the anchovies with the back of a knife, then finely chop and whisk with 1 tablespoon of water and the rest of the dressing ingredients.
Throw the beans into a pan of boiling water for 2 minutes then refresh under cold running water and drain.

Heat a splash of oil in a hot frying pan, pop the fillet in and fry for 4 minutes on each side. If it‚Äôs a little pink for you just finish it in the oven for another few minutes. Rest the fillet for 5 minutes, then slice.

To assemble the salad, toss the spinach and beans in 3‚Äì4 tablespoons of the dressing, then toss in the cro√ªtons. Crumble over the crispy ham, scatter over the beef slices and, using a vegetable peeler, shave over some Parmesan. Season and serve with the extra dressing on the side.

recipes.title: Tangy chicken and squash tray bake

ingredients.text: Finely grated zest and juice of 1 unwaxed lemon

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (fan), 200¬∞C, gas mark 6.
Trim the fatty, flappy bits off the chicken thighs but leave some skin on. Deseed the squash and chop into bite-sized chunks. Throw in a large oven dish with the chicken thighs.

Mix the rest of the ingredients together, stir and cover the chicken and squash thoroughly in the mix, then bake for 45 minutes till golden and the chicken is cooked through. Season and serve with something green that excites you.

ingredients.text: 4 cloves of garlic, peeled and left whole
2 soft apricots, stone removed and cut into quarters
¼ fresh coconut flesh and milk
1 ripe mango (peeled and cut into small wedges)
4 baby gem lettuce, leaves washed and root removed

instructions.text: Place the chicken into a pan and cover with water and all the remaining ingredients in the first part of the recipe.
Bring to the boil, simmer for 30 minutes, place a lid on top and turn the heat off.
Leave for one hour, then remove the chicken. Allow to cool, then remove the meat from the bones ensuring they are thumb size pieces (not too small). Reserve the carcass for making a stock.
Add the onions to a little rape seed oil and cook without colour for a couple of minutes.
Add the curry powder and cook or a further minute.
Add the wine and chicken stock and bring to the boil, then add all the fruit and the fresh coconut mil and cook until all the fruit is tender.
Blend in a food processor.
Allow to cool slightly then add the cr√®me fraiche.
Place the washed baby gem leaves onto a platter, then sprinkle the chicken over the top. Spoon over the sauce, then lay over the mango pieces and spring onions and garnish with the coriander leaves.
Serve with rice or new potatoes.

ingredients.text: 1 shop bought Swiss roll, sliced - preferably the kind with a jam and cream filling

instructions.text: Grate the orang zest into the cream and heat in a small pan.
Beat the sugar, cornflour and egg yolks together and slowly drizzle in the hot milk, whisking all the time so the eggs don't curdle.
Return the mixture to the pan and heat gently, stirring constantly until the custard thickens.
Pour into a clean bowl, cover the surface with cling film so it doesn't form a skin and set aside to cool.
Slice the Swiss roll and press into the bottom of a trifle dish.
Combine the berries with the mint and orange liqueur and spread over the Swiss roll.
Make the jelly according to packet instructions and pour over the fruit - put it in the fridge to set.
Pour cooled custard over the set jelly.
Whip the cream, creme fraiche and icing sugar together and spread over the custard.
Leave to set in the fridge for a few hours before serving then finish with grated chocolate orange and several glace cherries to dot around the top.

ingredients.text: 1x 375 g pack of ready rolled puff pastry
1 tsp cayenne pepper, or to taste
A dash of hot pepper sauce

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 220C/Gas 8.
Wrap each sausage in a slice of Parma ham and set aside while you prepare the pastry.
Unroll the pastry, squeeze a big dollop of tomato puree over it and use a spoon to spread it evenly over the pastry. Sprinkle over the parmesan and cayenne pepper and cut into 4 squares.

Place one Parma ham wrapped sausage on each square and roll them up, ensuring the joint is on the under side of the roll. Slash the top a few times with a small knife, brush with beaten egg yolk and sprinkle with salt.
Bake in the oven for 20-30 minutes until puffed up and golden.

recipes.title: Cod fillets with asparagus and salsa verde

ingredients.text: pieces of cod fillet (150g) scaled, skin left on
medium-sized Jersey Royal potatoes (washed well and cooked in salted water with skin on)
A good pinch of chopped parsley, chives and chervil

instructions.text: Add a drizzle of oil to a preheated pan. Lightly flour the skin of the fish, place skin side down into the pan and cook for 1 minute. Add a knob of butter and place into the oven for 4-5 minutes.
Lightly oil the asparagus and place onto a preheated griddle pan and colour on all sides. Remove and sprinkle with the Parmesan.
Crush the warm Jersey Royals with a fork and then fold in a drizzle of oil, a small knob of butter, lemon zest, watercress leaves and the tapenade.
Whizz the capers, anchovies, garlic, mustard and white wine vinegar in a blender, then slowly drizzle in the olive oil.
Add the chopped herbs (do not blend again).
Place the crushed potatoes in the centre of the plate, put the fish on top, then lay the asparagus on top of the fish and drizzle the salsa verde over the top.
Melt the chocolate and butter slowly together.
In another bowl, whisk the eggs, yolks and sugar until thick and creamy.
Add the chocolate mixture to the above and then finally add the flour and fold everything together.
Grease 6 ramekins and add the mixture to them. Bake in the oven at 230C for about 6 minutes.
You can either serve them in their ramekins or turn them out onto a plate and dust with icing sugar and serve with cream.

Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the honey and then all the other ingredients. Stir until everything is thoroughly mixed. Take a baking sheet, line it with baking parchment and spread the mixture evenly over the tin and bake in the oven at 180C/Gas 4 for approximately 15-20 minutes until nice and golden brown.
Take it out and leave it on the side to cool. Once cooled you can break it up into little pieces ready to crumble into the pudding as you assemble it.
Beat together all the cream, mascarpone, whiskey and icing sugar (preferably in a food processor) and beat until fairly stiff.

Defrost the raspberries and place a layer in the bottom of your dish. Sprinkle over some of the oat mixture and then a layer of the cream. Keep repeating this until you reach the top where you can sprinkle the final raspberries and a little icing sugar to dust the top.

ingredients.text: A little cold water to create a dough

instructions.text: Put all the ingredients for the pastry together in a mixer and combine thoroughly, adding the water at the end, just enough to make a dough. When it starts coming clear from the sides it is ready. You can also make this by hand by rubbing the flour and butter together to form crumbs, then adding the water as needed.
Roll into a ball, cover with cling film and place in the fridge to res for approximately 30 minutes.
Peel and slice the apples thinly and wash the blackberries.
Using two small enamel pie dishes, roll out the pastry and then line the bottom of both dishes. Be sure to cut out a circle for the top of each dish.
Place a mix of blackberries and apples into each lined dish and scatter over equal amounts of demerara sugar.
Place a circle of pastry on top of each dish and seal around the edges using the prongs of a fork. Also, pierce some holes in the top so that the steam can be released during cooking.
Glaze with a little white sugar and milk on the top and place into the oven at 180C/Gas 4 for approximately 30 minutes, until nice and browned on top.
Serve with cream and enjoy!

ingredients.text: Enough water to accommodate both whole fish in a large pot
Butter, to mix and for cooking

instructions.text: Add all the ingredients for the stock into a large pot and bring up to the boil.
Add the 2 whole trout and turn off the heat so that the fish can poach gently.

Whilst the fish is poaching, make the r√∂sti. Take the grated potato and place into the centre of a large square of muslin cloth. Gather the edges up and squeeze the water out of the potato. This will aid in keeping the r√∂sti together.
Add in some butter and salt and pepper to season. Be sure to only add enough butter to bind the mix together. Form the mixture into large patties (r√∂sti).
Melt some more butter in a large saute pan and place in the rostis. Cook on each side until golden brown and warmed through.
Gently remove the trout from the stock and remove the skin. Place on a plate with the r√∂sti and a dollop of creme fraiche.

ingredients.text: 3 egg yolks, reserving the whites for the meringue

instructions.text: Add the lemon zest, butter and sugar to the milk and bring to the boil. Once boiled, add it to your breadcrumbs and leave to cool for about 10 minutes, this will enable you to add the egg yolks into it without them scrambling!
Place into a pie dish and then spread out the raspberry jam on top.
Make the meringue by whisking the egg whites and slowly adding the 6 tablespoons of sugar until they appear glossy in texture and hold stiff peaks.
Arrange the meringue topping onto your pudding and place into the oven at 200C/Gas 6 for approximately 20 minutes until the meringue is nicely browned on top. Serve with some lush thick double cream!

ingredients.text: 6 chicken thighs, skinned, boned and diced into 1 inch cubes
4 garlic cloves, peeled and pounded until creamy
A few glugs of olive oil
1 red onion, peeled and finely sliced
1 small green pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
1 pitta bread, cut into squares and fried in olive oil

instructions.text: Soak the wooden skewers (if using), to ensure they do not burn during cooking.
Put the chicken thigh meat into a large bowl and add all the other ingredients, give it a good mix and leave to marinade for 15 minutes or longer if you have the time.
Thread the meat onto the skewers and place them on a hot griddle to cook for 8 minutes, turning and basting them to ensure even cooking.
First, macerate the red onion in the lemon juice for 10 minutes.
For the dressing, put the oil and lemon juice in a small bowl. Stir well and add the other ingredients.
Put all the ingredients in a large bowl and just before serving add the fried pitta bread and pour the dressing over it. Serve alongside the skewers.

ingredients.text: 1x 400 g tin red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
½ small iceberg lettuce, shredded, to serve
3 ripe roma (plum) tomatoes, diced, to serve
1 small avocado, peeled, stone removed and flesh diced, to serve
½ green capsicum (pepper), seeded, membrane removed and diced, to serve
1 small handful sunflower sprouts, to serve

instructions.text: To make the taco seasoning combine all the ingredients in a small bowl and stir to combine. Store in an airtight container until needed.
Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C (400oF/Gas 6).

Cook the potato in a saucepan of boiling water for about 10 minutes, or until just tender. Drain well, then transfer to a baking tray, drizzle over the olive oil and sprinkle over half of the taco seasoning. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes, or until golden.
Put the beans, lemon juice and remaining taco seasoning into a small saucepan over medium heat and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until warmed through.
Heat the taco shells according to the packet directions. To serve, fill each taco shell with some beans, potato, lettuce, tomato, carrot, avocado, capsicum and sprouts.

ingredients.text: 1 green chilli, deseeded and finely chopped

instructions.text: In a large pan bring the stock to the boil then add the rice. Stir, return to the boil, then cover with a lid and simmer over the lowest possible heat for 25-30 minutes or until the rice is cooked through.

Add a splash of oil into a non-stick pan and cook the salmon for 3-4 minutes over a medium to high heat until cooked three quarters of the way through. Turn the fish then turn off the heat and leave in the pan to finish cooking for 2-3 minutes.

In another pan fry the diced onion in olive oil for 5 minutes until softened, add the spices, chilli and cook for a further minute. Add the cooked rice and stir through, making sure it is well coated.
Flake the salmon into the rice and add the finely sliced spring onion and coriander. Season with salt and pepper and lemon juice.
Boil the eggs for 7 minutes - this will give you a medium runny yolk - then leave to cool slightly before peeling and cutting into quarters and adding to the dish.
Serve the kedgeree with a lemon wedge.
First, make the base by blending the biscuits until fine and mix into the melted butter.
Spread out in a wide flat tin (or large baking tray) lined with baking parchment and put in the fridge to cool and harden.

Blend the cream cheese and sugar together in a food processor and then add the lemon juice and whisk up again. Finally spread this on top of your biscuit base and refrigerate for several hours or overnight to set.
Cut into squares for serving and garnish with a few mixed berries over the top.
Heat the oven to 150C/Gas 2.
Mix everything together in a large bowl and combine thoroughly. Place in a greased cake tin and put in the oven for 1 hour, testing doneness with a skewer (it will come out clean).
Leave in the tin and whilst still hot, spear a few holes in the top and pour over the lemon syrup (method below). When cool enough, remove from the tin to a serving plate and enjoy.
Warm the juice with the sugar until it has dissolved.
Preheat the oven to 210oC (415oF/Gas 6‚Äì7). Lightly grease a 12-hole standard 125 ml (4 fl oz/1‚ÅÑ2 cup) muffin tin with olive oil spray or line with paper cases.
Put the blueberries and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the juices just start to run and the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
Sift the flour, baking powder and cinnamon into a bowl.
In a separate bowl, combine the egg, yoghurt and milk. Add to the dry ingredients and stir until well combined. Gently fold in the cooled blueberry mixture until combined.

Spoon the mixture evenly between the muffin holes and bake for 15‚Äì20 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the muffins comes out clean. Remove from the oven and turn out onto a wire rack to cool.

recipes.title: Smoky paprika chicken with chunky chips and dipping sauces

ingredients.text: 6 chicken thighs on the bone with skin
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
5 very large potatoes (weighing approximately 340g each), washed

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to gas mark 6/200C. Using a small, sharp knife cut three slashes on the diagonal through the skin and chicken flesh.

In a bowl, mix together the butter, mustard, honey and paprika. Place the chicken pieces in a large shallow roasting tin (thigh pieces skin side down). Brush one side of the chicken pieces with the paprika mixture and squeeze over the lime juice and place in the oven cook for approximately 25 minutes.
Turn the chicken over, brush with the remaining mix, and return to the oven for a further 25-30 minutes or until crispy and cooked through (juices must be clear and not pink).
Remove from the oven and serve in a small basket lined with greaseproof paper. Serve with the baked chips. Hand the dips separately with plenty of napkins alongside!
Preheat the oven to gas 6/200C.
Using a sharp knife, trim off the 2 sides and 2 ends of each potato. Cut each potato into nine equal sized thick chips.
Toss in 4 tablespoons of olive/rapeseed oil and season well.
Spread the chips out in a single layer on a large baking tray lined with baking parchment. Cook for approximately 1 hour, turning frequently.
To make the garlic mayo, simply put all the ingredients in a bowl, season well and stir together.
For the chilli sauce simply mix together your favourite ketchup with 3 to 4 teaspoons of ready-made sweet chilli sauce, depending on how spicy you like it.

recipes.title: Fresh herb omelettes with balsamic mushrooms

ingredients.text: 2 tbsp finely chopped flat leaf parsley

instructions.text: Heat half of the coconut oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until cooked and golden brown. Remove from the heat and stir in the balsamic vinegar. Set aside and keep warm.
Put the eggs and 2 tablespoons of water into a bowl and whisk until just combined. Add the herbs and mix well.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the remaining coconut oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour half of the egg mixture into the pan, swirling to coat the base. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until almost set. Fold the omelette in half, remove to a serving plate and keep warm. Repeat with the remaining oil and egg mixture to make another omelette.
Serve the warm omelettes with the saut√©ed balsamic mushrooms and the lettuce leaves on the side.
Preheat the oven to Gas Mark 4/180C/fan oven 160C.
Line two 12-hole muffin tins with cupcake paper cases.
In a small bowl, combine the flours and set aside.
In a large bowl, using the medium speed of an electric mixer, cream the butter until smooth. Add the sugar gradually and beat for about 3 minutes until fluffy.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the dry ingredients in three parts, alternating with the milk and vanilla. With each addition, beat until the ingredients are incorporated but do not over-beat.
Using a rubber spatula, scrape down the batter in the bowl to make sure the ingredients are well blended.
Carefully spoon the batter into the cupcake cases, filling them about three-quarters full.
Bake for 20‚Äì25 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cupcake comes out clean.
Cool the cupcakes in the tins for 15 minutes. Remove from the tins and cool completely on a wire rack before icing.
Place the butter in a large mixing bowl.
Add 500g of the sugar and then the milk and vanilla.

Using the medium speed of an electric mixer, beat for 3‚Äì5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Gradually add the remaining sugar, 125g at a time, beating well after each addition for about 2 minutes, until the icing is thick enough to be of good spreading consistency. You may not need to add all of the sugar.
If you wish, add a few drops of food colouring and mix thoroughly. Use and store the icing at room temperature because the icing will set if chilled.

recipes.title: Chewy white chocolate and macadamia nut cookies

instructions.text: Heat the oven to 180C/Gas 4.
Beat the butter and both sugars until light and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla extract and mix to combine.
Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix well, use a mixer if you have one, this will crush the nuts and chocolate pieces slightly as it goes.
Using your hands, roll into small balls and place on a baking sheet. Flatten them into rounds about 3 inches in diameter.
Bake for 11-14 minutes then cool on racks.

recipes.title: Grilled chicken breast with a warm spring vegetable salad

instructions.text: Cook 100g of peas in the stock and blend‚Ä®.
Add the other half of the peas then the cooked asparagus, cooked button mushrooms, onions and cherry tomatoes‚Ä®.
Add butter and shake in the season and add chopped parsley.
Meanwhile, take off the chicken skin, trim the bone and tap out the breast nice and thin.
Rub with olive oil and cook on a char grill on both sides, then season.
Using a slotted spoon, put the vegetables on a plate.
Lay a chicken breast on top, pour the sauce over and serve with new potatoes.
Preheat the oven to 150C/Gas 1.
Line a baking sheet with non-stick baking parchment or wipe the surface of greaseproof paper with vegetable oil to prevent sticking.
Separate the eggs one at a time into a small bowl, taking care not to include any yolks with the whites. As each egg is separated tip the white into a large mixing bowl.

Whisk the egg whites until they are stiff enough to hold their shape. Whisk in the sugar a tablespoonful at a time until all is combined. The mixture should now have a thick glossy shine to it and hold its shape well.

Using a spatula, turn the meringue mixture onto the baking sheet. Here you can spoon it into a vague circular shape, leaving a slight indentation in the middle for the topping. Bake for 1 hour, then turn the oven off and leave the pavlova base to cool completely in the oven.
Next, whip the double cream and prepare your fruit for the topping.
Once cooled, transfer the meringue onto your serving plate and spoon over the whipped cream.
Spend some time arranging your fruit artistically or pile it high as I do!
Just before serving, dust over a bit of icing sugar. Serve.
Cream the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and add the eggs one at a time until blended. Add the flour and mix in, then add the milk.
Take a 1 litre buttered pudding basin and place the syrup in the bottom. You can also drizzle this up the sides to ensure lots of sticky coverage.
Pour your cake batter into the bowl and then cover your bowl with greaseproof paper and secure with string.
Place the bowl in a large saucepan and fill with boiling water to about halfway up the pudding basin. Place a lid on it and steam for 1 hour.

Finally, take the basin out from the water, remove the paper lid and place a dinner plate on top and invert the dish, the pudding will easily slide out of its mould and the sticky syrup will be oozing down the sides. Place on the table and devour!

ingredients.text: 1 ball of mozzarella, torn into small pieces

instructions.text: Mix the sunblush tomatoes, mozzarella and basil and season. Then make a pocket in the chicken breasts lengthways and stuff with the tomato mixture.

Secure with a couple of cocktail sticks, place on a roasting tray drizzle with a little olive oil and roast in a preheated oven set at 200c/180c/Gas 6 fan for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through. When you remove the chicken check that the juices run clear then rest for 5 minutes.
Cook the quinoa to the packet instructions.
Add the rest of the ingredients, then dress with the olive oil and lemon juice to taste. Season and serve with the chicken.

ingredients.text: One full round of Fort Grey cheese (or other soft blue cheese)

instructions.text: Place the full round of cheese on top of the piece of rolled out shortcrust pastry.
With a sharp knife, puncture holes in the top of the cheese.
Fill the holes with a mixture of roughly chopped garlic cloves and sprigs of thyme.
Cover the cheese on top with another layer of pastry. Using an egg wash (beaten egg), bind the two layers of pastry together, and crimp the sides to completely encase all of the cheese.
Cover the whole pastry in egg wash, and place in a moderate oven (about 160C/Gas 2) for around 20-25 minutes until golden.

Remove from the oven and cut a hole in the top of the pie to reveal the melted, gooey cheese inside. Grab a stick of carrot, celery, pepper or whatever takes your fancy and completely enjoy this fondue set!
In a study pot, place the heads of a cod and turbot, cover with water and simmer for 20 minutes.
In a separate pan, add the olive oil and lightly fry the lobster shells for 2 minutes. Add the shells to the fish stock along with some salt and pepper, reserving the oil from cooking the shells.
Using the same pan, add a mixture of well chopped fennel, leek, white onion and celery to the lobster flavoured oil and gently saute on a medium heat until softened.
Add the well chopped garlic cloves and the cherry tomatoes.
Add 1/2 glass of white wine, a pinch of saffron and allow to simmer briefly.
Ladle 1 litre of stock into the vegetable mixture, enough to cover your fish.
Add the slices of turbot, wrasse and sea bream and poach until just cooked, around 20 minutes.
Add the shelled king prawns and lobster meat to the mixture, 3 minutes before the end of cooking time.
Finally add a splash of anise seed liqueur.
Cook until the fish is still firm but tender. Serve warm with bread and enjoy.

recipes.title: Roast pork fillet with apple potatoes

instructions.text: Cut the potatoes into rounds, about 2.5cm in height. Take out the centre of each round with a melon baller (Parisienne scoop).
Colour that side in oil then turn over and add in 1/2 pint of chicken stock.
Roast in the oven at 180C/Gas 4 for 30 minutes, brushing with melted butter occasionally until they're cooked.
Meanwhile, cut the apple into very small (.5cm) dice and cook in 30g of butter and a pinch of nutmeg. When just cooked, take out and cool.

Sear the pork in 1 tablespoon of oil, colouring the outside evenly. Season and then roast in the oven at 200C/Gas 6 for 12-15 minutes, ensuring that you do not overcook it (should be cooked to at least 63C). Take out of the oven and let it rest.
Meanwhile, shred the cleaned leeks and stew in 30g of butter. Separately, bring the cream to the boil and then add in the buttered leeks and season.
In the pan the pork was cooked in, first throw away the excess fat that came off the meat then add shredded sage leaves and the finely chopped onion and sweat, do not colour!
Add the Calvados and then 1/2 pint of chicken stock and reduce by 1/3.
Season, add cold butter and shake the pan to melt it. Then add the chopped parsley.
Put the diced apple into the centre of the potato rounds and reheat.
Put the leeks in the middle of the plate, 2 medallions of sliced pork on top, an apple potato at the side and gravy over and around.

recipes.title: Chicken and green vegetable rice with Stilton cheese

ingredients.text: 1 large onion, peeled and finely chopped
225 g rice, Basmati has probably the best flavour, but long grain would be fine
Small glass of white wine, optional
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200C/Gas 6.
Heat the oil in a medium sized saucepan that has a lid.
Add the onion and cook for 2-3 minutes to soften. Add the chicken and stir through.
Add the rice, carrot, wine, stock cube, water, frozen peas and beans.
Next add the spinach, if using. Season well with salt and pepper, and then bring to the boil, stirring.

Cover the pan with a tight fitting lid, turn the heat right down and cook for roughly 15 minutes in the oven, or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed. You will be amazed at how little heat is required, if you have a very tight fitting lid for your pan.
Once cooked, remove the lid and fluff up with a spoon or fork.
Add the cheese and fresh basil, mix well again and serve.

ingredients.text: 500 g selection of mixed berries, approximately
75 g butter, plus extra for topping

instructions.text: Mix the sugar and berries and then stir in the lemon zest and let it all macerate together. This causes the natural juices to blend with the sugar, while the zest gives the mixture a nice tartness.

Meanwhile, make the crumble topping. Mix the butter and flour together using your fingertips until it resembles a breadcrumb texture. You don't need to worry about consistency too much though, the more irregular the better as larger lumps will give a nice crunchy bite.
Next, add the demerara sugar and the flaked almonds. If you don't like almonds, you can leave them out or use something else like hazelnuts or walnuts.

Place the berry mixture into an oven-proof dish and then simply spoon on the crumble topping in little piles, trying to cover as much fruit as possible. Finally, top with a few dabs of butter over the top. Alternatively, you could spoon a bit of the mixture and crumble in individual ramekins to make a nice dinner party dessert.

Place in a preheated oven at 180C/Gas 4 for about 30 minutes until the top is nicely browned. You may need to bake for less time if you are using individual ramekins, just keep an eye on them in the oven.

ingredients.text: 6 cross fillets of plaice, skinned (or any flat fish)

instructions.text: Prepare the fish fingers by cutting across the fillets 1cm wide.
Mix together the breadcrumbs, lemon zest, dried dill, chopped parsley and pinch of paprika.

Roll the fish fingers through the flour, shaking off any excess, then in the beaten egg and finally in the breadcrumb mixture. Roll the fish to ensure that the crumb mixture adheres. Keep chilled until ready to cook.

To make the dip, head the oil in a saucepan, once hot add the butter and allow it to melt and add the diced bacon. Cook for a minute and add the peas, chilli flakes and cardamom. Cook for a minute and then add the lemon juice. Remove from the heat and blitz with a hand blender or mash with a potato masher. Add the creme fraiche and season to taste with salt.
Cook the fish in a shallow frying pan with a little vegetable oil until golden brown. Once cooked, drain on kitchen paper and serve with the fat chips (method below) and the dip.

Cut the peeled potatoes into thick wedges. Place the chips into a pan of boiling water and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain the chips and lightly coat with vegetable oil. Then place the chips on a baking tray into the oven at 250C/Gas 9 for 20-25 minutes until golden brown. Season with coarse sea salt.

ingredients.text: 2 350-450g red mullet (ask for a whole fish with liver's intact, or ask your fishmonger to prepare the fish and keep the livers)
½ bunch of flat leaf parsley
4 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped

instructions.text: Gut, scale and fillet the fish (if your fishmonger hasn't done it for you), being careful to remove the livers and keep them aside.

In a bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, chives, shallots, lemon zest and parsley. Chop the livers and add them in. Now, bind with the egg yolk and a squeeze of lemon juice, season with sea salt and pepper.
Divide the mixture into 8 small cakes, gently dust with flour and shallow fry them in a mixture of butter and olive oil until golden brown. Keep warm.
Dust the red mullet fillets in seasoned flour and cook skin side first in the same pan with a little butter and olive oil, no more than 2 minutes each side!
Serve on two plates with the forcemeat cakes, wedges of lemon and spoonfuls of the green herb sauce.

Chop the herbs finely and mix with the anchovies, garlic and capers. Add enough oil to loosen the mix without making it too runny. Finally, add the zest and splash of lemon juice and season with black pepper, the anchovies will give you all the saltiness you desire!

recipes.title: Goats' cheese and spring vegetable quiche

ingredients.text: 80 g cherry tomato halves, (pomordorino baby plum are best)
1 large yellow pepper (de seeded and cut into wedges)
Crushed sea salt and finely ground black pepper
Handful of rocket leaves to garnish
3 large roast beetroot peeled and cut into 1 cm cubes

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200C/gas mark 6. Roll out the pastry and use to line a 20-cm diameter (and ideally 5-cm deep) loose-based tart tin.

Line the pastry with a sheet of baking parchment and fill with baking beans. Bake blind for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and take out the baking parchment and beans. Reduce the oven temperature to 170C/gas mark 3.

Whilst the pastry is cooking, heat a chargrill pan to a high heat, take the pepper wedges and asparagus spears and place in a bowl. Lightly cover with oil and cook in the pan for 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Cook until they're only slightly coloured then drain and cool on kitchen towel.
Beat the eggs in a mixing bowl. Add the cream cheese and milk and mix to a smooth, creamy consistency. Add the chopped herbs and season with crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Take the pre-cooked tart case and spread the onion relish over the base. Scatter over the cherry tomato halves, grilled cut vegetables and crumbled goats cheese then pour the savoury mixture in.
Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and leave to cool on a wire rack.
For the beetroot side simply mix the diced beets, shallots, vinegar, oil and chopped parsley together and season to taste.
To serve, remove the tart from the tin and cut into slices. Serve at room temperature with a portion of beetroot salad and garnish with rocket leaves. Drizzle on some of the oil and vinegar dressing.

recipes.title: Cardamom chicken curry with easy rice

ingredients.text: A small bunch of fresh coriander, finely chopped
Juice of ¬Ω lime plus the zest

instructions.text: Place the chicken in a large bowl. Add the garlic cardamom and pepper. Mix well, cover and marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes to an hour.
Heat the oil in a wide pan over a medium-high heat and add the marinated chicken. Cook the chicken for 3-5 minutes to brown all over.
Now add the coconut milk with the lime zest and chillies. Simmer until the chicken is tender.
Squeeze over the juice of the lime and garnish with the chopped coriander. Adjust seasoning and serve with easy rice.
Wash the rice in hot water, then rinse in a few changes of cold water until the water runs clear.
Soak for 20-30 minutes in salted water, then drain.

Put the drained rice into a saucepan with a tight fitting lid, adding 450ml water and a teaspoon of salt. Bring to the boil over a medium - high heat and boil until the craters begin to show on the surface of the rice. Reduce the heat to the minimum and cover the pan with a clean dry tea towel. Cover with the saucepan lid, and fold back the overhang of the cloth over the lid.
Allow to cook for 15-20 minutes on the lowest heat. Do not open the lid until the 15 minutes have passed. Lift the lid and fold with a fork to fluff up the rice.

recipes.title: Roast pork and red wine lentils

ingredients.text: 1½ kg boned and rolled scored pork loin
Crushed sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 head of spring greens stalks removed and finely shredded

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 220C/Gas Mark 7. Put a lightly oiled roasting tray in to heat up.

Boil the kettle and put the pork loin in a colander in the sink and pour over boiling water. Remove and pat dry with kitchen towel. Season the scored skin with plenty of fine salt, then roll the pork in the preheated tray and roast for 20 minutes. Lower the heat to 190C/gas mark 5 and cook for a further 50 minutes.
Next mix the lemon zest, grain mustard and honey together. Remove the pork and brush all over with the glaze. Cook for a further 10 minutes so the glaze crisps up the crackling.
Remove the pork from the oven and brush any remaining glaze over the skin and rest for a good 15 minutes, lightly covered with foil.

For the lentils, heat a large saucepan to a medium heat, add a splash of olive oil and saut√© the bacon, carrot, onion and celery for 5 minutes to soften. Add the garlic, thyme, mustard, Worcestershire and lentils. Cover with the wine and stock, bring to the boil, reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes until cooked (the lentils should be just soft).
To cook the greens simply place in saucepan with garlic, butter, a pinch of salt and only a splash of water. Cover with a lid and cook fast and high for 4 minutes.

To serve, carve the pork and flash through the oven to warm. Heat the lentils, stir in some chopped parsley and serve on a warmed plate. Add a pile of buttered greens and top off with the carved pork and crackling.

ingredients.text: 1 head of garlic, cut in half
2 leeks (only use the whites, reserve the greens for the lamb shanks above)

instructions.text: Place a frying pan over a high heat. Add the shanks and cook for two minutes on each side or until they are well browned.
Place the shanks in a casserole dish with the rest of the ingredients. Cover the dish and bake at 160C/Gas 2 for 2 hours or until the lamb is very tender.
Strain a cup of the cooking liquor through a sieve and reduce by two thirds. Serve the shanks in deep bowls with the creamed leek mash and sauce poured over.
Peel the potatoes and cook in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and mash, then keep warm.
Cut the leeks in half lengthways, then slice thinly into strips.
Melt 50g butter in a heavy saucepan and add the leeks. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and cook them on a moderate heat for about 15 minutes or until the leeks are soft but without colour.
Put the remaining butter and the cream in a small saucepan, bring to the boil and stir through the warm mash. Finish by adding the leeks and adjust the seasoning. Serve with the lamb shanks.

recipes.title: Hot cross bread and butter pudding

ingredients.text: 6 shop bought hot cross buns (or homemade if you have them!)
4 egg yolks (you can freeze the whites for up to 1 month rather than discarding them)
1 tsp vanilla extract (if you have it)

instructions.text: Butter the buns and arrange in a suitable oven-proof dish, however you like. You can either tear them up and throw them in or you can cut and arrange nicely.
Sprinkle over the cinnamon.
To make the custard, simply whisk the egg yolks and sugar. Warm the milk and cream, then pour this over the eggs and sugar, whisking all the time. This is important so the eggs don't scramble.
Pour the custard mix over the bread, pressing down to make sure it soaks in.
Sprinkle with the demerera sugar for extra crunch and bake in a preheated oven at 180C/Gas 4 for 30 minutes.
Serve with lashings of cream and eat either hot or cold. Delicious!

recipes.title: Crispy bacon, avocado and spinach salad

ingredients.text: 1 large ripe avocado, halved, stone removed, peeled and sliced
1 bunch of watercress, washed and picked over
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Grill or griddle the bacon until really crisp.
Meanwhile, spoon the dressing ingredients into a small, clean jam jar.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Twist the lid on tightly and shake well.
In a large bowl toss all the salad ingredients together with the dressing and pile into a serving dish. Roughly crumble over the warm bacon and serve at once.

recipes.title: New potato and wild garlic quiche

ingredients.text: 450 g shortcrust pastry (shop bought is fine)
1 small egg and a pinch of salt, beaten together to glaze
300 g new potatoes, cooked and sliced
300 g new potatoes, cooked and sliced
1 clove of garlic, crushed or a few washed leaves of wild garlic shredded
1 egg beaten with a little salt for glazing

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to Gas Mark6/200C/400F.

On a lightly floured surface, roll out the pastry into a rough round approximately the size of a very large dinner plate. Line a large non stick baking tray with baking parchment. Transfer the pastry to the lined baking tray and relax in the fridge for 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat the oil and butter in a pan. Add the onions and gently fry for 20-25 minutes, until lightly browned and softened. Add the mustard to the onions, season with black pepper and allow to cool. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix together the cr√®me fraiche, eggs and wild garlic. Season with black pepper.

Pile the cooled onions onto the pastry round leaving a clear border of approximately 5cm around the edge. Top with the sliced potatoes, spoon over the cr√®me fraiche and scatter over the cheese. Carefully fold up the pastry border to create a rustic style edge. Brush the edge with the egg glaze.
Bake the pie in the oven for 35/40 minutes until the pastry is crisp and golden brown. Serve with crispy bacon, avocado and spinach salad.

ingredients.text: 1 side of salmon, skinned and pin boned, cut in half
Handful of spinach, picked and washed
2 medium carrots, peeled and cut into match sticks
Buttered Jersey royal potatoes, to serve

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 190C/Gas 5.
Lay one sheet of parchment paper on the work surface, 15-18 inches in length and 11 inches wide. Drizzle with olive oil.
In the centre of the paper, lay the batons of carrot, sliced chilli and garlic.
Lay one piece of salmon on top of this mixture, then place the spinach on top and then the other piece of salmon over.
Season the fish, then place the broccoli and tomatoes on top, finish with the thyme, squeeze of lemon and a drizzle of olive oil.
Now fold over the parchment paper to create a parcel, ensuring that it is well sealed.
Place onto a baking tray and put into the hot oven for approximately 15-18 minutes.
Remove, allow to rest for a couple of minutes, then unwrap and serve with buttered Jersey royal potatoes.

recipes.title: Roasted beetroot salad with avocado and horseradish dressing

ingredients.text: 1 tbsp omega 3,6,9 oil (eg. beauty oil etc)

instructions.text: Cut the beetroot into wedges, place in a roasting tin, and drizzle with a little olive oil, plus some salt and pepper, and place into a hot oven (200/gas 9), for around 20 minutes, or until the beetroot has become soft and the skin crispy.
Place the avocado, horseradish, lemon juice, and oil into a food processor along with a pinch of salt, and blend into a smooth, creamy dressing.

Assemble the salad by placing the leaves and cucumber in the centre of a salad bowl, and then place the roasted beetroot around the leaves. Add the dressing over the beetroot and leaves. Sprinkle with walnuts.

recipes.title: Mediterranean chicken with wedges and salad

ingredients.text: 250 g cherry tomatoes, cut in half
A handful of herbes de Provence
A handful of flat leaf parsley, finely chopped

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200C/Gas 6.

Place the chicken thighs in a large oven-proof dish, skin side up and drizzle with olive oil. Throw over the onions, cherry tomatoes and olives, then sprinkle over the crushed garlic and herbs. Season with salt and pepper and bake in the oven for 40 minutes.
When finished, take out of the oven and sprinkle with chopped parsley to serve.
Place the potato wedges into a roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle over smoked paprika, salt and pepper.
Bake in the oven the same time as the chicken.
Put the salad leaves, cucumber, celery and tomatoes in a bowl.
Heat some olive oil in a small frying pan, add the pine nuts and cumin powder. Heat through until the nuts turn a darker golden colour.
Pour the nuts in oil over the salad, then scatter over the spring onions. Serve with the chicken and wedges.

ingredients.text: A small amount of vegetable oil or duck fat
50 g butter, for when the puddings are cooked
70 g chocolate chips or 2 bars of your favourite chocolate, smashed up
A few teaspoons of sugar, to taste
Lightly whipped double cream, to serve

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 220C/Gas 8.
Start by making your Yorkshire puddings. Beat all of the ingredients together until smooth.
Heat a Yorkie or muffin tin in the oven with around 1 teaspoon of oil or lard in each hole. Allow this to heat until smoking then carefully pour the batter into each hole.
Bake for 20 minutes until golden and well risen. Alternatively, you can use leftover Yorkshire puddings for this recipe.
Turn the oven temperature to 180C/Gas 4.
Once the puddings have cooled down a little, put them into an oven-proof dish and slightly squash them down to flatten.
Dot the butter around the puddings.
Now make the custard. Beat the eggs and sugar together until pale and creamy.
Simmer the milk, cream and split vanilla pod. Once simmering, slowly pour into the eggs and sugar mixture, stirring constantly to ensure the eggs don't scramble.
Put the mixture back into the pan and cook until it starts to thicken, stirring constantly.
When the custard has reached the desired thickness you want, (keeping in mind it will thicken in the oven) stop stirring and pour over the Yorkshire puddings.
Chop up the chocolate and scatter it over the top of the dish. Place in the oven and bake for 30 minutes or until the custard is set and the top is nice and golden brown.

To make the raspberry sauce, simply pour the raspberries, sugar and water into a pan and mix gently over a low heat until the raspberries break down. You can pass you sauce through a sieve if you don't like the pips.
To serve, dust with a little cinnamon and drizzle the raspberry sauce on top and a bowl of whipped cream on the side.

recipes.title: Middle Eastern slow roast lamb shoulder

ingredients.text: 1x 2 kg shoulder of lamb, bone in (approximately)
Couple of glugs of olive oil
Zest of 1 lemon and juice of 1/2

instructions.text: Pierce the skin all over and push the garlic cloves into the holes.

Now to make the marinade, dry roast the cumin and coriander seeds in a non-stick frying pan until their aromas are released and they just begin to change colour, put them in a pestle and mortar, add the ground cinnamon, sumac (is using), salt and black peppercorns and bash until you get a coarse looking powder.

Add the oil, zest and juice of the lemon and give it all a good stir. Rub this over the lamb. If you have time, leave it to marinate overnight in the fridge, if not at least marinate for a couple of hours.
Six hours before you'd like to serve the lamb, heat the oven to 220C/Gas 8. Take the lamb out of the fridge and let it drop to room temperature.

Put the onions, carrots, celery and garlic into the roasting tray. Place the lamb on top then roast in the oven for 20 minutes, then take the lamb out and turn the oven down to 140C, pour the water over the vegetables (not over the meat) and cover loosely with tin foil. Put into the oven again and roast for 5 hours.

45 minutes before the end of cooking, take off the foil so that the skin can brown. When the cooking time is up, take out the lamb and check that it's cooked to the point of falling off the bone. Cover with foil and leave for 15-20 minutes to rest, if you want to be flash you can serv the meat with some freshly chopped coriander and pomegranate seeds.
For the rice"

Fry the spices in the butter. Add the rice and stir for 30 seconds, pour in the stock to cover, add salt and turn down to a simmer. Cover with a tight fitting lid and leave for 15 minutes on a very low heat. The stock should be completely absorbed when the rice is done.

ingredients.text: A couple sprigs of rosemary, chopped
½ Savoy cabbage, cooked and cut into large squares, rather than shredded
6 thick slices of leftover roast beef, or you could buy sliced roast beef for this
1 L vegetable or chicken stock (bought or home-made)
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 220C/Gas 7.

Mix together the Yorkshire pudding batter - you can do this the day before and leave in the fridge, covered until needed or make extra when making your Sunday roast and use that. You will need about a pint to a pint and half of Yorkshire pudding batter for this.
Add the chopped rosemary to the batter, mix and stir.

Chope the veggies and beef chunks then add to an oven-proof pan with some olive oil, of it you have left over beef drippings, that would work as well. Cook over a moderate heat to warm through and brown all over.
Pour the Yorkshire pudding batter over the veggies to just cover, then put it into the preheated oven for around 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve with the gravy (method below) over the top.

This gravy is best when using pan drippings left from a beef roast. Place your roasting tray on the hob over a medium heat and let it sizzle a bit, then sprinkle in the flour. Stir well, making sure that it gets nice and brown and soaks up all of the fat and juices. Add the wine, then stir vigorously to stop any lumps forming. Let this bubble a bit before adding the stock.

Turn up the heat to achieve a rapid boil, ten when the stock is bubbling away, add the Worcestershire sauce, ketchup and HP sauce. Whisk them in, season and once you have glossy gravy, strain it through a sieve into a jug. Stir any resting juices into the gravy and serve immediately.

ingredients.text: 1 medium red chilli, finely chopped (you can de-seed and remove the membrane to make it less spicy)
Good pinch of salt and pepper
15 g or a small handful of coriander, chopped
½ cucumber, peeled, de-seeded and chopped into crescent shapes
Juice of 1/2 lime (you can cut the other half of the lime into wedges to serve on the side)
1 iceberg lettuce head, cut into quarters, to serve

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200C/Gas 6.
Mix together all of the ingredients for the meatballs in a clean bowl and then shape into small meatballs or thin sausage like shapes, if you want to make koftas.
In a large oven-proof pan, add a splash of olive oil and seal the meatballs on all sides until starting to brown. This should only take a couple of minutes.
Transfer the meatballs to the oven and cook for around 10-12 minutes, until cooked all the way through.

Place the flour in a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the centre of the flour and pour in the yoghurt, oil and salt. Add 1 tablespoon of water and work the flour into the liquids. Add another tablespoon of water, and keep adding a tablespoon at a time until you have a firm dough.
Knead the dough for about 3-4 minutes until smooth and shape into small, flat discs.

To cook, heat a tablespoon of oil in a griddle or frying pan, then add the flatbread discs one at a time and fry for 2-3 minutes, on both sides. The flatbread is done when it has browned and puffed up. Remove to drain on some kitchen paper.
Mix together the yoghurt and cucumber in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Stir in a squeeze of lime juice.
Simply grab a flatbread, tear off a couple of lettuce leaves and place in the bottom of the flatbread. Top with a couple of meatballs and a dollop of the raita and squeeze of lime, if you like!

recipes.title: Mixed herb and nut pesto pasta

ingredients.text: 1 courgette, peeled into long, thin strips
300 g dried pasta shells or conchiglie pasta if you can find it
2 garlic cloves, minced on a grater
120 g mixed nuts such as peanuts, salted cashews and pistachios

instructions.text: Cook the pasta shells in lightly salted water according to the packet instructions. Stir the pasta once at the start of cooking to prevent sticking.

Heat a griddle, or a non-stick frying pan, and dry fry the bacon until crispy on both sides. Once crisp, remove and drain then add the peeled courgette strips to the same pan and griddle for a couple of minutes to colour and crisp up but be careful not to burn them.

Meanwhile, add in the herbs, leaves, minced garlic and nuts into a blender and squeeze in the juice of half a lemon. Blitz until roughly combined, then gradually pour in half of the olive oil and blitz into a paste consistency. Add the rest of the olive oil.
At this stage you can transfer the pesto to a sealable container and store in the fridge until needed. It should keep for a couple of weeks in the fridge.

Drain the pasta and place into a bowl. Pour the pesto on top and crumble over the feta cheese. Mix together so the pasta is well covered and the pesto collects in the pasta shells. Transfer to a serving bowl.
Chop the bacon into small pieces and scatter over, along with the griddled courgette strips. Squeeze over some more lemon juice and drizzle with a little olive oil, then serve.

Using a food processor or an electric whisk, blitz or whizz the butter, sugar, flour, ground almonds, eggs and vanilla extract. Plop half of the mix into the lined cake tin and smooth out.

Now, dot the jam, 1/2 teaspoon at a time, all over and scatter with the raspberries. With the remainder of the cake mix, drop dollops over the fruit to cover but don't worry about the holes, just use your fingers to spread it about a bit.

ingredients.text: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: For the pastry:
Sieve the flour and salt, and chop up the lard and butter into small pieces straight from fridge.
Rub the lard and butter into the flour then add enough water to pull the pastry into dough.
Leave to rest for 30 minutes.
Trim the meat of all fat and gristle and cut into small cubes and put into a bowl.
Chop the onion finely and add to the bowl.
Peel and cut the potatoes into quarter inch cubes and add to the bowl.
Cut the carrots and turnip (or Swede) to the same size and add to bowl and mix well.
Season with salt and pepper then add a splash of Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco sauce. Add chopped parsley.
Cut the pastry into 4, pin out then cut into circles 6‚Äù across. Make the egg wash with a spoonful of water and brush the edges of the pastry.
Pile some filling into middle of each pastry piece and spread in a line across the centre
Fold the pastry over and up to make a seal on top of the filling, then using your thumb and forefinger, crimp the edges in a wavy fashion.
Brush with egg wash and make a hole in the top for the steam to escape.
Bake at 200C for 30 minutes then 180C for a further 20 minutes.
Serve hot or cold.

ingredients.text: 300 g farfalle pasta or any pasta shape you like
1x 200 g pack of tender stem broccoli, cut into thirds
A small handful of basil leaves

instructions.text: Place the pasta in boiling water in a large saucepan, and cook according to the packet instructions. Add the tender stem broccoli to the pasta for the last 5 minutes of cooking.

In another large frying pan. add a good glug of olive oil and toast the garlic over a moderate heat for a couple of minutes, but be careful not to let it burn - this will release all the flavour and aroma of the garlic. Add the salted anchovies, chilli, tomatoes and stir. The anchovies will dissolve into the oil after a couple of minutes.

With a large slotted spoon, remove the pasta and broccoli from the pan of water and drop into the frying pan making sure a few drops of the pasta water get into the sauce. Toss the pasta so it gets covered in the sauce.
Season the pasta well with lots of black pepper. Add the zest of the lemon and squeeze over some lemon juice. Add a splash of white wine vinegar and a few picked basil leaves and stir.
Place the pasta into a large bowl and grate over some parmesan. Finish with a good glug of olive oil and a few more basil leaves.

recipes.title: One pot beef meatballs with couscous

ingredients.text: ½ green chilli deseeded and finely diced

instructions.text: Combine the mince, 1/2 onion, breadcrumbs, egg yolk and flat leaf parsley and season.
Roll into golf ball sized meatballs and fry off in a medium-hot pan until coloured all round. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, chilli and paprika and continue to cook for a couple of minutes. Pour in the red wine and reduce by half, then add the tomatoes and stock.
Return the meatballs to the pan and bring to the boil before reducing the heat and covering with a lid and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the sugar and season with salt and pepper.
Add the couscous to the pot and stir in, adding a little water if needed. Re-cover and continue to cook for 5 minutes then add a squeeze of lemon juice.
Garnish with flat leaf parsley and serve.

recipes.title: Sticky lemon chicken with chickpea salad

ingredients.text: 8 chicken thighs and drumsticks from a mixed pack
1 head of garlic, cloves separated and skin left on
Bunch of flat leaf coriander, chopped
A bag of mixed baby salad leaves
1x 400 g tin of chickpeas, drained and rinsed

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a pan that‚Äôs big enough to hold all the chicken. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and brown it in the pan over a high heat. After a couple of minutes, throw in the garlic and thyme and turn the chicken so it browns on each side.

Once the chicken is nicely browned, add the vinegar, soy sauce and honey and turn the chicken pieces around so they get coated in the sauce. Then add a splash of hot water and the lemon slices and cover with a lid.
Let the chicken cook through and the liquid reduce down until syrupy, this should take 10 ‚Äì 15 minutes. Keep your eye on it and add more water if the pan starts to look too dry.
Stir in chopped coriander and drizzle with sesame oil before serving.
Combine the salad leaves, chickpeas and spring onions in a bowl and toss together.
Make a dressing with olive oil and lemon juice, toss through the salad.
Season to taste and serve.

recipes.title: Steamed rhubarb sponges with vanilla icecream

ingredients.text: 3 large eggs, whites and yolks separated

instructions.text: Chop the rhubarb into small cubes and place in a pan with a splash of water and about 5 tablespoons of caster sugar. Allow it to cook gently for about 5 minutes (until the rhubarb has lost its bite) then remove about three quarters (250g) of the syrupy cooked rhubarb and set aside. This will cool and be used in the pudding moulds. The rest should continue to cook until it has completely stewed down into a puree. This will be used at the end.
Preheat the oven to 180C and butter and sugar the inside of 6 x 200ml pudding moulds. Divide the 250g of cooled rhubarb between the moulds.
Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks and sugar until light and fluffy. Scrape the seeds from the vanilla pod into the egg yolk mix, then stir in the melted butter and buttermilk.
Gently mix in the flour and baking powder to form a batter, then fold in the egg whites.

Spoon the mix into the prepared moulds leaving a slight gap at the top of the mould. Stand them in a baking tin full of boiling water, being careful to not let the water go over the edge of the pudding moulds (this is known as a water bath). Cover with buttered tin foil and cook for 30 minutes, rotating after 15 minutes. Remove from the water bath and allow to sit for a few minutes.
Remove from the water bath and allow to sit for a few minutes.
Turn out the sponge into the centre of the bowl, pour a little of the rhubarb puree over the top and serve with vanilla ice cream.

ingredients.text: 2 large cooking apples, peeled, cored and chopped

instructions.text: Fry the onions in oil until soft, then add the bite-sized pieces of stewing pork.
Sprinkle the flour over the meat and onions, and mix in the cider and lemon juice.
Add the coriander seeds and rosemary, and slow cook for an hour in the oven at 140C/Gas 1.
Then, add the chopped mushrooms and apples, and continue to simmer for a further twenty minutes in the oven.
Season the dish with salt and freshly ground black pepper, and add the cobnuts.
Cook for a final five minutes to warm the nuts through and serve right away.
This is delicious served with mashed potatoes and a green salad.

ingredients.text: 1 tbsp Thai curry paste, preferably yellow, but red or green will do
2 cm root ginger, cut into matchsticks
1 cauliflower head, broken into florets less than 1cm in size
1x 300 g packet of rice noodles, pre-cooked according to the packet instructions
1 hard boiled egg, chopped, to garnish
1 cauliflower head, chopped into small florets

instructions.text: For the curry, slowly cook the onion with the turmeric and the Thai curry paste in a pan until soft. Add water if it gets too hot or sticks to the pan too much.
Add the coconut milk and bring up to a simmer. Add the chilli, ginger and finally the cauliflower and simmer for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, to make the fritters as an extra garnish, mix together the flour, spices, salt and pepper in a bowl. Add sufficient sparkling water gradually to make a thick batter.

Dip the cauliflower florets into the batter mix then with a slotted spoon, very carefully drop one by one into a pan with about half a centimetre or so of hot vegetable oil. Carefully turn them over when browned.
Add the prawns to the curry and simmer for 2 minutes until cooked.

To serve, add the cooked noodles to a bowl and pour the curry over the top. Squeeze over the lime juice and sprinkle over the lime zest then garnish with coriander, hard-boiled egg and the cauliflower fritters.

ingredients.text: 100 g smoked streaky bacon, cut into small slices

instructions.text: Cut the chicken thighs into quarters then fry for 5-6 minutes in a hot pan with some oil.

Add the bacon, onion, garlic, chilli and rosemary and cook over a med heat for a further 3-4 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes then simmer for another 3-4 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and the sugar.
Cook the pasta to the packet‚Äôs instructions in boiling salted water, drain, then add to the sauce.
Grate over some parmesan cheese before serving.
Garnish with some chopped flat leaf parsley.
Cream the butter with the garlic and parsley.
Spread onto a sliced baguette, wrap in foil and bake for 10 minutes at 190C.

recipes.title: Sea trout on Jersey Royals with a watercress sauce

instructions.text: Wash the potatoes well and then cook.
Trim the trout fillets.
Rub the bottom of an ovenproof dish with 1 oz butter and sprinkle with shallots.
Lay the fish on top.
Add the wine and stock to the dish.
Cover with greaseproof paper and cook in the oven gently at 180 c for 10 minutes (or until cooked).
Take the dish out of the oven. Remove the fish and keep warm.
Place the stock in a saucepan and reduce the liquor by half.
Meanwhile melt 2 oz butter and add picked leaves of watercress and 2 chopped spring onions.
Sweat gently for 3-4 minutes making sure to maintain the colour
Add cream and the remaining 2 oz of butter, and bring to the boil.
Pass through a food processor and then through a fine sieve, add to reduced stock and season.
Slice the potatoes. Mix with a little olive oil and the remaining chopped spring onion and lay on plate. Pour over the sauce.
Lay fish on top of the potatoes and sauce, brush with olive oil and serve.

recipes.title: Lamb kebabs with peas and mint pesto

ingredients.text: Olive oil (enough to loosen the pesto)

instructions.text: Marinate the cubed lamb in the olive oil, lemon juice, oregano and 2 cloves crushed garlic. Leave for at least 2 hours but preferably longer.
Thread onto skewers and cook on a preheated griddle for 1-2 minutes per side. The overall cooking time will be around 6-8 minutes. Leave to rest for 5 minutes.

Add the mint to a blender along with the rocket, walnuts and rest of the garlic garlic. Drizzle in the oil whilst blending until you have a loose consistency. Add the grated parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Add the lemon juice to taste.

Meanwhile, boil the halved new potatoes until cooked through, drain and set aside. Place in a bowl along with the peas and dress with the pesto. Serve the potatoes along with some feta cheese and the kebabs.

ingredients.text: 15 g wasabi paste or 2.5cm of fresh wasabi root
6 Granny Smith Apples (or 250ml pressed apple juice)
fine 66% dark chocolate, broken into pieces.

instructions.text: Put the apple juice, sugar and wasabi in a pan and bring to a simmer.
Allow the wasabi to infuse into the apple juice for 5 minutes. Have a taste to check the strength of the wasabi and add more if required.
Pour the hot liquid on to the chocolate in a bowl and whisk well until smooth.

recipes.title: Sweet potato with French green beans and buttermilk with coconut rice

ingredients.text: 550 g sweet potatoes peeled, cut into 1.5cm cubes
200 g French beans stringed and cut into 2.5cm lengths
30 g freshly grated coconut or 15g desiccated coconut
3 dried red chillies and 2 green chillies, deseeded
2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves and a generous handful of spinach, shredded

instructions.text: Put the cashew nuts and melon seeds into a bowl and pour over hot water from the kettle. Leave to soak for 15 minutes, then drain.
Separately blanch both the sweet potato and the French beans in boiling salted water for 5 and 2-3 minutes respectively. Drain and refresh in cold water. Set aside.
In a jug blender grind together the nuts, melon seeds, coconut, turmeric, ginger, deseeded chillies, salt to taste, and enough of the buttermilk to make a very smooth paste.

In a separate pan, heat both the oils over a medium heat until hot. Add the mustard seeds, cumin seeds and the dried chillies. Once they crackle and pop and have turned a shade darker, add the curry leaves and the nut mixture and continue to stir-fry for a minute or so.

Reduce the heat and pour in the remainder of the buttermilk and add the pumpkin and green beans. Simmer for a few minutes, adjust seasoning. Sprinkle over the chopped coriander, shredded spinach and serve.
Wash the rice in hot water; rinse it several times in cold water to remove as much starch as possible. Leave to soak in salted water for 15 minutes. Drain and wash the rice again to remove the salt.

Using a heavy bottomed pan with a fitted lid, heat the oil/ghee over a medium heat, add the rice and gently saut√© until the grains are coated by the oil. Add the water, salt and the coconut milk. Bring to the boil.

Cook the rice until most of the liquid has absorbed and small craters appear on the surface. Place a clean dry cloth over the mouth of the saucepan and cover with the fitted lid. Leave to simmer on a very low heat for approximately 15-20 minutes. Do not lift the lid during this cooking process.

Once the cooking time is completed, remove the pan from the heat. Lift the lid and add the toasted coconut. With a fork gently fold in the coconut, making sure you don‚Äôt break the grains. Serve on a platter with the fried onions.

ingredients.text: 175 g unsalted butter (left out of fridge to soften)
3 large eggs, whisked in a bowl.
175 g unsalted butter (left out of fridge to soften)

instructions.text: Sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder into a bowl. In a separate bowl cream together the sugar and butter.
Once the butter/sugar mixture is creamy, slowly pour in the whisked egg mixture and whisk together.
When that's all done, fold in the flour/cocoa powder and fold in gently, making sure you keep as much air in the mixture as possible.
Finally add in 2 tablespoons of creme fraiche and fold in.
Now put an even amount of the mixture into 2 separate tins - and put into a preheated oven, at 170 degrees, for between 20 - 25 minutes.
Once the cake is done, leave to cool for at least 20 minutes.
Mix together the butter with the sifted icing sugar in a bowl.
Put the Oreo cookies in a food mixer and blend until completely crushed.
Add them to the bowl, as well as the vanilla extract and the double cream. Mix together until smooth.
Use half of the mixture to sandwich together the two halves of cake, and put the other half on top.
Use chocolate sprinkles as you wish to decorate the top!

recipes.title: Roasted butternut squash with sage and feta

ingredients.text: Small bunch of fresh sage, or 1 teaspoon of dried sage.

instructions.text: Dice the butternut squash, leaving the skin on, and place into a roasting tin.
Keep the garlic cloves whole, and bash them with a knife, or even the palm of your hand, just to split them. Add them to the tin with the squash.
Drizzle over some olive oil, along with sea salt, black pepper, and if using dried sage, add at this point.
Roast in a hot oven for around 20 minutes, or until the squash is starting to brown and caramelise at the corners. If using fresh sage, chop it and add it in at this stage.
Once the squash has been divided up into four portions, top each portion with a quarter of a pack of feta.

ingredients.text: Half a red or orange pepper

instructions.text: Chop the tomatoes, pepper and radishes and serve with the spinach.
Serve with your favourite dressing.
Roughly crush the cheese with a fork in a bowl.
Mix in the yoghurt and mustard and season with pepper (If the yoghurt is quite thick, you may want to add 1-2 tablespoons of cold water).
Serve with burgers in warm baps with the salad.
Preheat the oven to 180C. Grease the bottom of a 23cm/ 9 inch springform round cake tin.

To make the topping, combine the flour, sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. Cut the butter into small pieces and rub it in with your fingers until it resembles fine bread crumbs. Add the nuts if using and mix well.
Sprinkle with the cold water and toss in lightly so it forms little clumps. Set aside.
Combine the flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt by sifting together in another bowl.
Put the eggs in a large bowl and whisk together a little. Add the milk, sugar and melted butter.
Add the flour mixture into the egg mixture with a wooden spoon. Lightly fold until all combined.
Pour the apple and lemon juice over the grated apple and sultanas. Fold these into the cake mixture.
Pour the cake mixture into the greased cake tin.
Sprinkle the topping onto the surface of the batter.
Bake in the oven for 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes, and take out of the springform to cool completely.
Cream the butter and sugar, add the lemon rind and eggs, then fold in the sifted flour. Mix until fully combined, then fold through the curd.
Pour into a greased 1kg baking tin. Bake in a pre-heated oven set at 180C for approximately 1 hour.
Meanwhile mix the lemon juice and sugar and pour over the cake as soon as it comes out of the oven. Leave to cool.

recipes.title: Sesame soy salmon with shredded Asian vegetables and coconut rice

ingredients.text: 3 handfuls of mixed shredded vegetables (carrot, courgette, red onion, spinach, mushrooms)

instructions.text: Make a marinade for the salmon using the soy sauce, sesame oil, and honey. Mix these ingredients together in a bowl. Add the salmon back to the bowl and cover well in the marinade. Marinate for 2-4 hours.
